name: 4-Day Great Migration at Masai Mara Budget Safari

overview.route_description: Witness an amazing annual event of the great migration. Naming one of the seven wonders of the world, this mass movement of wildlife is a spectacle like no other. Enjoy the most dramatic episode which is the perilous crossing of the Mara River by thunderous swarms of wildebeests. It’s the stage for a gripping, life-and-death scene where the wildebeests must survive the danger of the water’s currents, the stampede of its own herd, and the jaws of the Nile crocodiles that lie in wait.

day_1.description:
Departing from the capital of Kenya, Nairobi, you will drive down the escarpment via the floor of the scenic Great Rift Valley. After that, you arrive at your overnight camp, located on the border of Masai Mara, in time for lunch. This afternoon you will explore Masai Mara on your first game drive, getting a taste of what this legendary game park has to offer.
You will stay in budget safari tents overlooking the untamed savannah plains and woodlands of Masai Mara. At night, you can hear a chorus of different animal sounds as the creatures of the wild communicate with each other in the darkness, more than enough reason to visit.

day_2.description: After breakfast, we carry packed lunches and set off to search for great predators and perhaps even cubs continue today during extensive game runs. On the plains are enormous herds of grazing animals plus the elusive Cheetah and leopard hiding amidst acacia boughs. During our stay, we also have an optional opportunity to visit a village of the Masai people to witness the singing and dancing that are part of their daily lives and sacred rituals. A glimpse into their homes and social structure is a poignant experience.

day_3.description:
Day is spent game viewing in Kenya's finest wildlife park, the Masai Mara. Game drives will take you in search of Africa's Big Five and the plethora of other wildlife inhabiting this vast Kenyan game reserve. Wherever you go in the vast Masai Mara, you will see an abundance of wildlife such as Masai giraffe, baboons, warthogs, bat eared foxes, grey jackals, spotted hyena, topis, impala, hartebeests, and wildebeest. Elephants, buffaloes, zebras, and hippos are also found in great numbers. It is also common to see lions either basking after a heavy meal or surveying the plains for their next meal. Cheetahs and leopards are harder to spot but reasonably common.
The annual wildebeest exodus, great migration, in July and August when millions of grass eaters move north from the Serengeti in search of lusher grass before turning south again in October. Hot-air balloon trips are an entirely outstanding way of seeing the savannah plains teeming with wildlife can be arranged at extra cost.

day_4.destination: Masai Mara to Nairobi, Kenya
day_4.description: You will depart from your safari camp and take a morning game drive through the Mara on day four. Then, you return to bustling Nairobi, arriving at about 2 p.m. in the afternoon. This unforgettable 4-day budget Maasai Mara camping safari ends upon arrival back in Nairobi.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 3-Day 2Nights Amboseli National Park Aa Lodge Amboseli

overview.route_description: This amazing wild safari tour covers 3days, 2nights in Amboseli National Park and includes guests/clients park entry fees, meals on full board(lunch, dinner and breakfast), 4game drives, transport by safari van with a pop up roof for game viewing/photography on private basis, and accommodation at Amboseli AA Lodge. The Lodge has an en-suite swimming pool, private built-in toilets, hot showers, and an electric power supply from a generator. Come explore Amboseli National park with us!

day_1.description: We will meet you at the airport, and after a short briefing, we will depart for Masai Mara National Reserve to start your safari. We will have a short stop at the Great Rift Valley viewpoint, where you can take photos. Then, we proceed to Masai Mara National Reserve, arriving in time for lunch and checking in at Rhino Tourist Camp. In the afternoon, we will have another game drive in the reserve. Your dinner and overnight stay are at the camp.

day_2.description:
After breakfast, we depart with a lunch box and spend the whole day game viewing. The game drive will be extensive and cover large parts of the golden savannah grasslands, where we will see many herbivores grazing. In addition, we will look for predators in the hope of seeing them while they are hunting their prey. After lunch, we will embark on an afternoon game drive until the early evening.

You can visit a Masaai village or drive straight to the lodge after the game drive. Your dinner and overnight stay are at the camp.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve to Lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description: After an early morning game drive, we return to the lodge for breakfast. After breakfast, we will check out and drive to Lake Nakuru National Park, where we will check in and enjoy our lunch. Finally, we will embark on a game drive in the Great Rift Valley in the afternoon. This area is often called the bird spectacle, with many pink flamingos forming a pinkish canopy along the lake's shore. You will have a panoramic view of the lake and park from the cliffs. Your dinner and overnight stay are at the lodge.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park to Nairobi
day_4.description: After an early morning game drive, we return to the lodge for breakfast. After breakfast, we will check out and depart for Nairobi. Upon arrival in Nairobi, we will transfer you to your hotel or the airport, depending on your request.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 4-Day Masai Mara, Lake Nakuru National Park Lodge Safari

overview.route_description: The Masai Mara National Reserve is located in the southwest of Kenya, in the foothills of the Rift Valley. The park has an area of 1510sq km and is famous for its annual wildebeest migration. The park has a global reputation of being Africa’s richest game reserve. The park has abundant wildlife that freely roam in the reserve. A Masai Mara safari provides a distinctive unmatched experience across the wildlife plains.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_1.description: This morning we'll pick you up from the airport or from your hotel and depart from Nairobi at 8.30 am. We'll drive through the view point of the Great Rift Valley to the Masai Mara National Reserve. This enormous reserve is actually part of the vast Serengeti plains famously known for its spectacular great wildebeest migration. It is home to the Big Five: lion, elephant, leopard, buffalo and rhino. On arrival, have lunch at the lodge and relax before departing for the afternoon game drive. The Mara National Reserve is one of the greatest wildernesses of the world. Large mammals are varied, and easy to see. The wild animals found in the park are: Masai giraffe, buffalo, eland and thousands of plain game including impala, zebra, both Thomson’s and Grants gazelles. Dinner and your overnight are at the lodge.

day_2.description: This is a full day spent viewing the great predators and exploring the parks amazingly high concentration of wild animals. On the plains are enormous herds of grazing animals plus the elusive cheetah and leopard hiding amidst acacia boughs. During our stay we'll have an optional opportunity to visit a village of the Maasai people to witness the singing and dancing that is part of their daily lives and sacred rituals. A glimpse into their homes and social structure is a poignant experience. Dinner and your overnight stay are at the lodge.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve to Lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description: Have an early morning game drive. Then return to the lodge for breakfast and depart for Lake Nakuru National Park located in the Great Rift Valley. After lunch, enjoy an exciting game drive until 6.30 pm in the evening. The park is a home to stunning flocks of Lesser and Greater flamingoes, which literally turn the lakeshores in to a magnificent pink stretch. The birdlife here is world renown and over 400 birds species exist here, white pelicans, plovers, egrets and marabou stork. It is also one of the very few places in Africa to see the white and black rhino and rare Rothschild giraffe. Dinner and your overnight stay are at the hotel/lodge.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park to Nairobi
day_4.description: On day 4, there is a brief morning game drive into Lake Nakuru National Park following a delicious breakfast at lodge. After breakfast, our SUV would take you back to Nairobi. Our clients enjoy en-route sight seeing with optimum pauses for photo sessions and wildlife viewing. Our tour guide will drop you off at Nairobi Airport and with that, our trip to Kenya comes to an end.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 3-Day Maasai Mara Mid-Range Safari(Group Joining Safari)

overview.route_description: Enjoy thrilling 3 days Masai Mara Safari starting and ending in Nairobi with accommodation in a mid-range safari lodge equipped with hot shower and private toilet. You'll come across the big five and many other wildlife species found in this famous reserve. If you wish you can meet native African people such as the Maasai, with trips to their villages to learn about their lives and culture. In 3 days, you will experience the best that Kenya has to offer.

day_1.description: You will be met by our representative for a tour briefing at your hotel or airport. Afterward, depart for your journey to the Maasai Mara Game Reserve. You will stop at the viewpoint of the western Great Rift Valley and Narok Town, where you will have lunch and refuel. Your journey continues into the Maasai plains and you will arrive at the lodge in the afternoon. After check-in, you will take off on your first game drive tracking various animal species and birds. You will return to the lodge in the evening for dinner and your overnight stay.

day_2.description: After breakfast, you will enjoy a full day of game viewing within the reserve. The scenic landscape includes the savannah grassland on rolling hills. The Maasai Mara reserve is the best park for game viewing in Kenya as it has an extensive road and track network which allows for close-range viewing and photography. You will take a break for your picnic lunch at the hippo pool, looking out for hippos and crocodiles. Later in the evening, you will return to the lodge for dinner and your overnight stay.

day_3.description: You will wake up before dawn and take off for your last game drive. Enjoy the sights and sounds of the Mara during the sunrise hours when prey and predators engage in their morning rituals. After this exciting tour, you will return to the lodge for breakfast, check out, and depart for your journey back to Nairobi. You'll have a picnic lunch in Mai Mahiu and arrive back in Nairobi by 4 pm.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 3-Day Amboseli National Park Safari

overview.route_description: We drive by road to Amboseli on this national park safari to experience wildlife game viewing of wide varieties of wild animals and bird life. Amboseli National Park is famous for being the best place in Africa to get close to free-ranging elephants among other wildlife species. Other attraction of the park includes opportunities to meet the Masai people and also offers spectacular picturesque scenery, which benefits from the beautiful backdrop of snow covered, Mount Kilimanjaro.

day_1.description: Meet and greet services on arrival in the morning at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport or pick up from your hotel at 0800hrs by our driver-guide. Leaving the bustling city of Nairobi, we drive south to Amboseli National Park, located at the foot of snowcapped Mt. Kilimanjaro, Africa highest peak. We arrive at our lodge in time for lunch, relax at leisure and later on embark on evening game drive in the beautiful Amboseli National Park. We have dinner and overnight at the Lodge. Meal Plan: Lunch and Dinner.

day_2.description: This day is set aside exploring Amboseli National Park with early morning game drives where the light is perfect at Mount Kilimanjaro background which offers good photographic scenery coupled with the concentration of wildlife on the ground. We return to the lodge for breakfast. We will be free the rest of the morning may be enjoying a dip in the pool or game viewing from the lodge terrace. We later explore an evening major game drives. We return to the same lodge in Amboseli, for a night under starry skies. Amboseli National Park is at the foot of Africa highest mountain, 5895m Mt Kilimanjaro, this National Park offers some of the best opportunities to see African animals because its vegetation is sparse due to the long dry months. Amboseli National Park is home to wild animals, which includes the African elephant, buffalo, impala, lion, cheetah, hyena, giraffe, zebra, wildebeest among other African animals.

day_3.description: Early morning game drive at sunrise followed by breakfast at the lodge. We depart Amboseli National Park viewing game en-route as you exit the park with the last picturesque of Amboseli. We drive back to Nairobi arriving Nairobi in the afternoon. You will be dropped at either your hotel or airport to connect with your home bound flight depending on the arrangements where the safari ends. Meal Plan: Breakfast.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

overview.route_description: This safari tour is everything that you have wished for. You will have the chance to mingle with the most amazing wildlife that Kenya has to offer. Masai Mara, home to various kinds of animals, is an enormous national park and you will get the chance to witness the most dramatic episode which is the perilous crossing of the Mara River by thunderous swarms of wildebeests. Lake Nakuru, you will visit a sanctuary, home to a colony of about 25 white and black rhinos.

day_3.description:
Early morning tea/coffee or Hot chocolate, then depart for a morning game drive. Here we find the Old Africa of the movies, with rolling grasslands dotted by acacia trees and sweeping plains teeming with wildlife. After a full English breakfast back at the camp, depart for Nakuru, you can have a stopover at Lake Naivasha for boat ride and feeding the fish eagles. Or just head to the hotel in Nakuru and spend afternoon by the pool.
Overnight at Lanet Matfam Resort.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru tour to Nairobi
day_4.description:
After breakfast, proceed for a game drive in the rhino sanctuary which is home to a colony of about 25 white and black rhinos. Predators are also resident in the park. Later, you will leave for Nairobi after lunch. This is the end of the safari.
*Meal plan: Breakfast and lunch.

name: 3-Day Luxury Honeymoon Package to the Masai Mara

overview.route_description: Spend your honeymoon at the intimate and private Emayian Luxury Camp on this 3 day safari to the Masai Mara. This safari promises to be quite an unforgettable experience with a stay in one of the finest camps just outside the Mara. Indulge in a much needed soak in an outdoor jacuzzi decorated with rose petals after a long day of game drives and experience fine dining with a special touch in every single meal. This tour is not for love birds only, anyone can tag along. Let us take you there.

day_1.description:
You'll be picked up from your hotel or the airport, and depart for a scenic drive down to the Rift Valley, as you proceed to the Masai Mara, Kenya's premier game reserve. You will be in your own private safari vehicle. You will stop briefly en route at the Great Rift Valley Viewpoint for stunning views of what is the world's largest valley. You'll arrive at Masai Mara in time for a delicious lunch and check in. Then you'll go for an afternoon game drive at 4 pm. This allows spotting of the unrivaled wildlife in the park.

Upon returning to the camp, you will find the outdoor jacuzzi that is just outside, on the porch of your tent, already filled and decorated with rose petals. Indulge in a soak and relax as you listen to the sounds of nature.

Dinner and your overnight stay will be at Emayian Luxury Camp.

day_2.description:
Today, we shall be on a game viewing extravaganza!

Masai Mara National Reserve remains to be the most exciting wildlife eco-system in the natural world.

It is host to the highest and most varied concentration of wild animals than any other wildlife park in the region.

The scenic appeal of the tree-studded savannah plains, the moderate climate and the diversity of wild game species make it a one-stop shop for game viewing activities.

We shall traverse the Masai Mara reserve on a full day of unlimited game viewing encountering the Big Five and more of the lesser game.

Your picnic lunch shall be by the Mara River as we watch hippos and crocodiles or maybe the great migration (July – October).

Dinner and your overnight will be at Emayian Luxury Camp.

day_3.description: On this last day of your safari, you will have an early morning game drive and then a champagne bush breakfast with live cooking. After checking out, we will journey back to Nairobi arriving late in the afternoon. You will be dropped off at the airport or your preferred location.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

overview.route_description: This tour will take you to the Northern part of the country. Samburu National Reserve is famous for its herds of elephants and home to the reticulated giraffe, Beisa Oryx and Grevy Zebra. The Ewaso nyiro river passes through this park and its the main source of water for the wild animals and human staying near the Manyattas.

day_1.description:
You'll be picked up from the hotel in the morning and driven to Amboseli National Park. It is famous for its scenery with a backdrop of snow-capped Mount Kilimanjaro, which dominates the landscape and open plains. Arriving with a short game drive, have lunch and a short rest. Then you'll go for an afternoon game drive. Later, check out of the park and drive to Nairobi arriving at around 5/6pm for your drop off.

Amboseli National Park is located in Loitoktok District, Rift Valley Province of Kenya. The ecosystem mainly savannah grassland spreads across the Kenya-Tanzania border. The park is famous for being the best place in Africa to get close to free-ranging elephants among other wildlife species. It is also a home to the Big Five. Other attractions of the park include opportunities to meet the Maasai and see the spectacular views of Mount Kilimanjaro.

day_2.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

overview.route_description: An adventure of its kind that takes you to two of the Kenya’s most popular wildlife protected areas that is Masai Mara and Lake Nakuru. The tour gives you an opportunity to see different animal species as well as numerous species of birds. It’s a tour that can be booked throughout the year. The two parks do not disappoint, there is a lot to see at any given time of the year.

day_1.destination: Nairobi – Masai Mara National Reserve (265 km – 5 to 6 hrs)
day_1.description:
Your pick-up will be early in the morning from Nairobi, with a briefing from your guide before departing for a drive through the Great African Rift Valley. There are opportunities to take photographs across the stunning vistas and breath-taking landscapes, such as the Suswa Ranges and Mount Longonot, throughout the trip.

You'll arrive at Masai Mara in time for lunch. After a short break to settle in, you’ll get stuck into the safari tour with your first afternoon game drive through the Masai Mara. This allows spotting of the unrivaled wildlife in the park. You'll then return to your lodge by 6.30 pm. Dinner will be served as you spend your first night inside the park.

Dinner and your overnight stay will be at Entim Mara Luxury Camp.

day_2.destination: Full Day in Masai Mara National Reserve
day_2.description:
Breakfast at your camp or lodge will be served before you head out on your full day game drive through the grasslands and rolling hills of Masai Mara Game Reserve. A picnic style lunch is served on the banks of the Mara River, and if you’re visiting in the right season, you may just get to witness the iconic migrations of the Serengeti. You are also provided the option of visiting a village of Masai Mara warriors. The culture of these nomads is known the world over, their courage in battle with wild animals is stuff of legend. Your visit will include a traditional welcome of singing and dancing and you will be invited to learn some of the culture and visit a home in the village. At no extra fee for this activity.

Dinner and your overnight will be at Entim Mara Luxury Camp.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara – Lake Nakuru National Park (300 km – 5 to 6 hrs)
day_3.description:
A morning game drive comes after breakfast at your accommodation, forming part of the journey you will make to Lake Nakuru, giving you time to bid farewell to the beauty of the Masai Mara. Another picnic lunch will be served during your journey through the landscapes of Kenya, with chances to capture the scenery with your camera along the way also.

Early evening arrival at Lake Nakuru gives chance for dinner to be served and for you to understand the mega-fauna and exotic birds that will be on display the following morning.

Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the Cliff.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park – Nairobi (167 km – 3 to 4 hrs)
day_4.description:
Morning rolls around with a game drive through Lake Nakuru National Park. Be ready to spot some of the most fantastic birds, including the pink flooding the lake as flocks of flamingo feed on the algae within.

Mammals also populate this stunning lake; with luck you will be able to see the rare Rothchild Giraffe, black and white rhino, waterbuck, impala, and buffalo. Your expert Kenyan tour guide will be able to help you understand the animals you see and track any that are close by.

Lunch is served by the lake, readying you for departure to Nairobi. Hotel, residence, or airport drop-off are offered at your convenience.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

The Camp has an en-suite swimming pool, private built-in toilets, hot showers, and an electric power supply from a generator. Come explore Masai Mara Game Reserve with us at this Luxury Camp Sarova Mara Game Camp!

day_1.description:
At 7:30 hrs, you will be picked up from your hotel in Nairobi and drive to Masai Mara in the southern part of Kenya. The Masai Mara National Reserve is one of Africa's most well-known reserves famous for its rich wildlife, spectacular scenery, plentiful wildlife, and unending savannah grassland composed of vast rolling plains and hills dotted with umbrella thorn acacias and thorny thickets. The great migration which occurs every year from July to September is possibly Mara's most famous feature. More than 1.5 million wildebeest and zebras migrate from the Serengeti to the Mara. The Serengeti and Mara parks are interconnected wildlife havens and both are a photographer's paradise!

At noon, you'll arrive at your lodge for check-in and lunch, relax for a few hours before you embark on an afternoon game drive to discover Masai Mara National Reserve. Late in the evening, you will return to your lodge for dinner and your overnight stay.

day_2.description:
You'll go on a full-day game drive after breakfast and a packed lunch box shall be arranged on today. The Masai Mara is home to not only the Big Five but also many many other wildlife species. Elephants, buffalos, giraffes, lions and cheetahs are spotted in the reserve. Leopards are common, endangered black rhinos can be seen hiding in impenetrable thickets. The Mara River is home to massive hippos and gigantic crocodiles. Over 450 species of birds can be found in the reserve.

There are optional activities that you can participate in today. A hot air balloon adventure (extra cost) will take you to the skies that will see you soar above the game in action. You can also visit a traditional Maasai village (extra cost) to experience how the Maasai people live in the middle of the bush with lions roaring outside their homes. Also, get to know their culture and customs.

After a successful day of searching for the 'Big Five', you will return to your lodge for dinner and an overnight stay.

day_3.description: After breakfast, you will check out of the lodge and drive to Nairobi arriving in the afternoon. You’ll be dropped off at your hotel in Nairobi or transferred to Jomo Kenyatta International Airport to proceed with your onward arrangements.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

This safari is a celebration of Africa's diversity and it takes you to the Rift valley lakes of Naivasha and Nakuru, which are home to flamingos and hippos and to the famous Masai Mara, which is home to all the big 5. You'll be accommodated in budget hotels and camps which have hot showers and private toilets. This is a bush experience that will create lifetime memories.

day_1.description: Arrival at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport in Nairobi where you will be met by our represetative. Depending on your arrival time, we shall either take you to your hotel in the city or depart for a drive into the Great Rift Valley and on to Lake Nakuru national park in the late morning. Lake Nakuru is one of the several Rift Valley lakes and its ecosystem supports a wide ecological diversity with Flamingos (Greater and Lesser) and other water birds being the major attractions of the area. The ecosystem provides for about 56 different species of mammals including the white rhino, buffaloes and a variety of terrestrial birds numbering nearly 450 species. The park is truly remarkable as it has achieved international fame on animal sanctuary. Both black and white Rhinos are being given a new lease of life in this park. You will go for a game drive in the late afternoon which will include a walk by the shores of the lake to get up-close with the many birds found here.

day_2.description: Have a leisurely breakfast at the hotel. Proceed for a further drive at the park and depart in the late morning for the nearby Lake Naivasha, a fresh water lake which is a popular tourist spot in Kenya for locals and foreigners alike. Check in at Sweet Lake Resort and have lunch. The lake offer beautiful natural spaces where you can see numerous bird species among the trees as well as spot some animals ranging from waterbucks to warthogs. You may also choose to book a one hour Lake Boat Safari at extra cost during which you get to see some of the lake's wildlife such as hippos as well as enjoy the picturesque views of the lake and surrounding highland landscapes. In the late afternoon, you can visit the Crescent Island where you get to walk in the park to see the animals such as Giraffe, zebra and antelopes. Naivasha is also known for the many birds that can be sighted within the lodge grounds.

day_3.description:
We’ll have an early breakfast followed by your drive to the Masai Mara. With the expanse of the Masai Mara National Reserve spread before us, you’ll know you have arrived at some place special. Kenya’s most popular park, the reserve is world-famous for its incredible density of wildlife and during the Great Migration (July – October) an unending torrent of gazelle, wildebeest, and zebra streaming into the park.
All of Africa’s Big Five are here and so much more animals. Arrive in time for lunch. Enjoy an afternoon game drive to track elephants, leopards, cheetah, lions, and buffaloes. Drive back to the camp for dinner and overnight.

day_4.destination: Maasai Mara
day_4.description: Enjoy an early morning breakfast, you will then proceed for a full day game drive carrying picnic lunch with you. On this day you will drive to the Hippo Pool where you can take a break from the drive and see the Hippos bathing. Enjoy a further game drive at the park.

day_5.destination: Maasai Mara/Nairobi
day_5.description: Have an early morning drive followed by a scrumptious breakfast then departure for your drive back to Nairobi. Arrival will be in the afternoon. Drop off at the airport.

day_6.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

day_1.description: You will be met by our representative for a tour briefing at your hotel or airport. Start the 5 hour journey to Maasai Mara Game Reserve with a brief stop over at the Great Rift Valley view point. You will proceed to Masai Mara Sopa Lodge arriving in time for Lunch. Afternoon game drive in search of the Big 5 among smaller wildlife. Overnight at Masai Mara SopaLodge on full board basis.

day_2.description: Today we have arranged morning and afternoon game drives in the Mara Reserve searching for lion prides, cheetah, leopard, elephant, water buffalo, giraffe and various plains game. Option to visit a Maasai Boma which can be arranged by your tour driver/guide and paid directly by clients. Overnight at Masai Mara Sopa Lodge on full board.

day_3.description: Full day spent game viewing exploring the park in search of the Big 5. Early morning and late afternoon game drives are offered. You will enjoy a picnic lunch with the hippos and crocodiles at the Hippo Pool. Breakfast, lunch, dinner and overnight at Masai Mara Sopa Lodge on fullboard basis.

day_4.destination: Masai Mara Game Reserve - Nairobi
day_4.description: After breakfast you will begin your 5 hour journey back to the city with game viewing en-route in the reserve. Upon arrival in Nairobi you will either be transferred to your city hotel or straight to Jomo Kenyatta International Airport (JKIA) for your outbound flight home.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 3-Day Tsavo East and Amboseli National Park

overview.route_description: This safari visiting two national parks affords its participants to have close encounters with elephants, cheetahs, lions etc in both parks, and not forgetting the breathtaking views of Mount Kilimanjaro. This safari can either start from Nairobi or Mombasa depending on the guests arrival destination. Amboseli National Park is also famous for being the best place in Africa to get close to free-ranging elephants among other wildlife species.

name: 5-Day Highlights of Kenya Safari Mid Range

overview.route_description: When considering where to go on your Kenyan safari, the two most likely destinations you’d think of are the Masai Mara and Amboseli. This tour offers you exactly that: plenty of time in two of the most iconic safari destinations in the world. These two areas, although geographically close together, offer different worlds, with landscapes and features unique to each yet both equally accessible.

day_1.destination: Nairobi – Masai Mara National Reserve (265 km, 5 to 6 hours)
day_1.description:
To give as much time as possible to immerse yourself in nature, you will be picked up from your hotel, residence, or the airport at 5.30am to embark on your safari. The early start will give you chance to see the Kenyan countryside as it awakes to start a new day. You will see sunrise as you progress south through the Great African Rift Valley, and your guide will be able to stop for you at strategic locations for photo opportunities along the way.

You’ll stop at the town of Narok to get a hearty breakfast, Kenyan style, to give you energy to head out into the savanna upon arrival. Through the gates of the Masai Mara, the game viewing commences. As you’d expect from such a renowned reserve, here you can see the big five of African safari:

*Elephants
*Rhinos
*Lions
*Leopards
*Buffalo

You’ll have lunch served as a picnic, keeping your surrounded by nature for as long as possible.

Sure to be tired after a long and adventurous day, you will be taken you to your chosen camp or lodge.

day_2.destination: Full day inside Masai Mara National Reserve
day_2.description:
You may not have a lot of time on safari in Kenya, but you can still pack in plenty of experiences to make it the trip of a lifetime. The first morning on safari presents a chance to take a hot air balloon ride over the plains to watch the sunrise and the park awaken. Watching the movement of the animals from the air offers a different perspective, allowing you to understand the patterns more, and get scenic photos with long shadows cast over dusty lands. The trip is rounded off by a bubbly bush breakfast served on a view platform above the Masai Mara. There is an extra fee for the activity of $490 per person.

Even if you choose to remain with two feet firmly on the ground this morning, you still have ample chance to spot animals on a dawn game drive before breakfast back at your accommodation. The rest of the day will be spent traversing this vast land, flat and grass covered, lunch is offered today as a picnic, relaxing by the Mara river and surrounded by the wildlife.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara Game Reserve – Amboseli National Park (515 km, 9 to 10 hours)
day_3.description:
Your swansong to the Masai Mara will come in the shape of one last game drive to depart the park, following an early breakfast.

Although long, the journey to Amboseli will be broken up with stops at opportune locations for photos of the beautiful scenery. There’ll be lakes, rivers, and mountains along with snapshots of everyday life for Kenyans. In a local town, you’ll stop for lunch and a chance to stretch your legs on the journey.

Entering Amboseli, the most striking feature is undoubtedly Mount Kilimanjaro. The mountain stands steadfast; an eternal backdrop to all your photos of the park. As you head towards your accommodation, you will have a brief game drive. The lands here have more trees than the Masai Mara, yet the same brilliant range of wildlife is present, too. Once at your selected camp or lodge, you will be given dinner and time to enjoy the views from terraces or picture windows that are on offer. This, the third day of your Kenyan safari.

day_4.destination: Full Day inside Amboseli National Park
day_4.description:
Bright white snow may not be the first thing that comes to mind when contemplating your Kenyan safari, yet an early morning game drive out in Amboseli should afford you wonderful views of the snow-capped peak of Africa’s highest mountain, Kilimanjaro. As the sun spills over the landscape and begins to bounce off the ridges and creases of the mountain, the colors and views will evolve through the morning. Once the clouds start to build, it’s back to your camp or lodge for breakfast, before another full day out exploring the plains.

Having lived a nomadic life in these lands for thousands of years, the Masai people have a special connection with the savanna. Their culture has tales of lion-fighting warriors and they have a deep understanding of the lifecycles of Amboseli. One can will be shown around the village and presented with a chance to visit a house of one of the Maasai families. This mind-expanding visit is an optional extra, priced at $20 per person.

day_5.destination: Amboseli National Park – Nairobi (250 km, 4 to 5 hours)
day_5.description:
Since you’ve been rising early every day, finish your safari in the same way and head out for a dawn game drive. Along with a second chance to photograph Kilimanjaro without the daytime clouds, you get to appreciate the dawn chorus of the birds and mammals rising from their slumber and calling to their herds, prides, and flocks as the new day begins.

Once you’ve had your fill of nature, it’s time to fill up on food at your camp or lodge and take a long, slow, drive out of the park so you can fit in one last game drive. From the gates of Amboseli, it’s off westwards to return to Nairobi. This is your last chance to watch the world pass by and eat a delicious lunch at a local town.

Upon arrival in Nairobi in the early afternoon, the next step is up to you. You can request your guide to drop you off either at your hotel, your residence, or at the airport to catch a flight to your next destination, or home.

day_6.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

day_1.description:
0700hrs, drive to Lake Nakuru National Park. You will be stopped at the Great rift valley View for Photography. Proceed to Lake Nakuru and arrive in good time for lunch. Immediately after lunch enter the Park for Game drive until Sun Set expecting to see a lot of Flamingos, Lions, Rhinos and many more other animals.
Dinner and overnight stay at Wagon Wheel Hotel.

day_2.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park-Maasai Mara Game Reserve
day_2.description: 0700hrs after Breakfast, depart to Masai Mara Game Reserve. Drive through Narok with a view of Mahiu mau scenery. Stop for a washroom break in Narok and proceed to the Lodge for checking in and Lunch. 1530hrs, depart for the afternoon game drive until Sun set. Dinner and over Night at Rhino Tourist camp.

day_3.destination: Full day Maasai Mara Game Reserve
day_3.description:
0700 hrs after breakfast, depart with Packed lunch boxes for a full day game drive in search of more game. You have a chance of seeing all the Big 5 and other Wild animals. You will also be driven to the Mara River to see the Migration of wildebeests that happens between July and August. There are also Hippos and Crocodiles to be seen.
Proceed with Game Drive until 1700hrs when you drive back to the Camp for Dinner and overnight stay.

day_4.destination: Maasai Mara Game Reserve- Nairobi
day_4.description: 0730 hrs after breakfast, check-out and depart with game drive en-route expecting to arrive at your hotel or Airport late in the afternoon.

name: 3-Day The Cliff Lake Nakuru National Park Luxury Safari

overview.route_description: Perched at the top of a 100 metre high rock face sits Lake Nakuru's smartest addition - The Cliff – a 10 room luxury camp. While 'luxury camp' is the simplest description, in reality The Cliff located inside the park defies conventional labels, being a combination of safari lodge, tented camp and boutique hotel, constructed and furnished in a contemporary European style.

day_1.description: Pick up from the international airport or city hotel in Nairobi. Depart and drive to Lake Nakuru National Park, arriving in time for lunch at the camp. After lunch, relax and later on enjoy a late afternoon game drive to see the huge numbers of flamingo which are concentrated along the lake shore. In addition to the bird life for which Nakuru is so well known there are many different wildlife species in the park including lion, leopard, Black rhino, White rhino, buffalo, Rothschild’s giraffe, zebra, impala and waterbuck. Return in the evening back to the camp for dinner and overnight.

day_2.description: Optional early morning game drive for 2 hours before breakfast to try to find the nocturnal cats before they go into hiding which are frequently sighted in Lake Nakuru Park and return to the camp for breakfast. After breakfast you will take a further drive to seek out other game - including the rhinos found in the park, returning before lunch. The afternoon is at leisure, relaxing by the camp's swimming pool before an optional late afternoon game drive in the park. Return back to the camp for dinner and overnight.

day_3.description: You have the optional to do an early morning game drive for 2 hours before breakfast. Check out. Depart and drive back to Nairobi. Upon arrival, transfer to the international airport or city hotel ending your memorable safari with us.

name: 3-Day The Famous Mara - Mid-Range

overview.route_description: This is a 3-day safari visiting the most famous national park in Kenya, the Masai Mara. The Masai Mara National Reserve is one of the best places in Africa for wildlife viewing. Game drives are a great way to experience the park and they take place all year round. If the big cats are what you're looking for on your Kenyan safari, you are guaranteed to spot them at the Mara. For bird lovers, the Mara birds come in every colour and size with more than 400 bird species, including birds of prey.

day_1.description:
You'll have an early morning drive to Masai Mara National Reserve. It holds on as one of the few places left on earth where wildlife still lives comparatively undisturbed, in the numbers that once roamed the plains and forests of Africa. As the northern tip of the vast Serengeti ecosystem, the Mara hosts spectacular seasonal migration of many thousands of wildebeest, zebras and attendant predators. Arrive in time for lunch then have an afternoon game drive. Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the camp.

Note: Accommodation can be upgraded to higher-level options or downgraded to more economic ones (price reduction).

day_2.description:
After breakfast, we will have a full-day game drive, with packed lunch provided. The reserve is well known for its black-maned lion, as well as its abundant resident wildlife. It's one of the few places where it's possible to see the Big Five during a morning game drive. Many of the cheetahs are so tame that they seek shelter from the hot sun under one's vehicle and several even climb onto the roof to get a better view of prospective prey. For the bird enthusiast, almost 500 species have been recorded: among these 16 species of eagle, plus many hawks and falcons, 6 species of vultures, 8 species of storks 4 of bustard (including the kori bustard, the world's heaviest flying bird), and 9 species of sunbirds.

Note: Accommodation can be upgraded to higher-level options or downgraded to more economic ones (price reduction).

day_3.description: We will wake up early at 6 am for a sun-rise game drive. At 9 am, we will drive back to your accommodation for brunch then depart for Nairobi. Have lunch en-route and arrival in Nairobi late in the afternoon.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 2-Day Amboseli National Park & Mt Kilimanjaro Safari

overview.route_description: We'll take you to the foot of Mount Kilimanjaro and get amazing photos of its peak in our 2 days safari. Enjoy amazing game-viewing drives with close-up moments of the huge elephant herds. Take an evening or morning drive and spot the lions as they hunt. The pink flamingos colour the waters of Lake Amboseli. For bird watchers, this is a must-do experience where you get to view over 400 species of birds.

name: 4-Day Panoramic Amboseli & Tsavo West Mid - Range Safari

overview.route_description: This tour takes us to Amboseli National Park Amboseli which is known as the best place in Africa for getting up close to free-ranging elephants. The sparse vegetation also provides excellent opportunities for viewing the buffaloes, impalas, lions, cheetahs, hyenas, giraffes, zebras, and wildebeests. The bird life is equally rich especially in the park’s marshes and lakes. Later proceed to Tsavo West National Park is known for bird life and for its large mammal’s though sparsely populated.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Amboseli Appx: 250 kms -5 hrs drive
day_1.description:
Depart for the Amboseli National Park via the Nairobi-Mombasa Road. The morning drive is via typical African savanna country dotted with local homesteads and colorful Maasai herdsmen grazing their cattle.
Arrive in time for lunch and later venture into the park for the scheduled afternoon game viewing drive.
There is no doubt that during this tour, you will spot the free-ranging herds of elephants up close in the park – a little wonder why the park is the best place in Africa to spot such herds. It is home to many other species such as the African elephant, Cape buffalo, Impala, Lion, Cheetah, Spotted hyena, Maasai giraffe, Zebra and Blue wildebeest among other African animals. Birdlife is also abundant, both large and small species. Weather permitting, Amboseli national park offers a beautiful vista of the scenic snow-capped Mt. Kilimanjaro which makes it a perfect site for photography. It is the tallest mountain in Africa and the highest free-standing mountain in the world.

day_2.description:
Another day to enjoy full day game viewing extravaganza in Amboseli. With its reputation for active elephant sighting it’s easy to spot them roaming the plains in the morning and evenings. And during much of the day you can observe them splashing and foraging in Ol Okenya Swamp.
We shall also stop at the observation hill to view the sprawling breath-taking view of Amboseli.
You may opt to have the full day game drives or game drives in separate successions so that you may also have a chance to enjoy lodge facilities.
The driver guide shall be readily available to discuss your daily activities as per your preferences including an optional visit to a Maasai village at an extra cost.
Every safari is different according to your wishes, likes and expectations. Just let us know how you would like to customize your special journey.

day_3.destination: Amboseli to Tsavo West National Park Appx: 110 kms 2 hrs drive
day_3.description:
Early breakfast then check-out and proceed to Tsavo West National Park commonly known as “Land of Lava, Springs, Man-Eaters & Magical Sunsets”.
From the sight of fifty million gallons of crystal-clear water gushing out from the under parched lava rock that is the Mzima Springs, to the Shetani lava flows, Tsavo West is a beautiful, rugged wilderness. The savannah ecosystem comprises of open grasslands, scrublands, and Acacia woodlands, belts of riverine vegetation and rocky ridges including the Poacher's Lookout where visitors can see the teeming herds in the plains below.
Tsavo West offers some of the most magnificent game viewing in the world. The attractions include elephant, rhino, Hippos, lions, cheetah, leopards, Buffalos, diverse plant and bird species including the threatened corncrake and near threatened Basra Reed Warbler.
Arrival for lunch, followed by afternoon game drive.

day_4.destination: Tsavo West to Nairobi Appx: 290 kms - 5 to 6 hrs drive
day_4.description:
Early breakfast then check-out and proceed for the morning game viewing drive as you exit the park. Thereafter depart for Nairobi arriving in late afternoon.

Drop off at your hotel/residence/Airport for your onward flight.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 6-Day Amboseli NP, Lake Naivasha & Maasai Mara Mid-Range

overview.route_description: This Safari will take you to the "Land of Giants". Weather permitting, Amboseli national park offers a beautiful vista of the scenic snow-capped Mt. Kilimanjaro which makes it a perfect site for photography. It is the tallest mountain in Africa and the highest free-standing mountain in the world. Then proceed to Lake Naivasha which is located on the floor of the Great Rift Valley with great views. Finally head to the famous Maasai Mara which is an animal paradise.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Amboseli National Park - Appx: 250 kms: 5 hrs drive
day_1.description:
Depart for the Amboseli National Park via the Nairobi-Mombasa Road. The morning drive is via typical African savanna country dotted with local homesteads and colorful Maasai herdsmen grazing their cattle.
Arrive in time for lunch and later venture into the park for the scheduled afternoon game viewing drive.
You will spot the free-ranging herds of elephants up close in the park – a little wonder why the park is the best place in Africa to spot such herds. It is home to many other species such as the Cape buffalo, Impala, Lion, Cheetah, Spotted hyena, Maasai giraffe, Zebra and Blue wildebeest among other African animals. Birdlife is also abundant, both large and small species. Weather permitting, Amboseli national park offers a beautiful vista of the scenic snow-capped Mt. Kilimanjaro which makes it a perfect site for photography. It is the tallest mountain in Africa and the highest free-standing mountain in the world.
Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_2.description:
On this day, enjoy full day game viewing extravaganza in Amboseli. With its reputation for active elephant sighting it’s easy to spot them roaming the plains in the morning and evenings. And during much of the day you can observe them splashing and foraging in Ol Okenya Swamp.
We shall also stop at the observation hill to view the sprawling breath-taking view of Amboseli.
You may opt to have the full day game drives or game drives in separate successions so that you may also have a chance to enjoy lodge facilities.
The driver guide shall be readily available to discuss your daily activities as per your preferences including an optional visit to a Maasai village at an extra cost.
Every safari is different according to your wishes, likes and expectations. Just let us know how you would like to customize your special journey.
Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_3.destination: Amboseli National Park to Lake Naivasha Appx: 350 kms: 7 hrs drive
day_3.description:
Early breakfast then check-out and proceed to Naivasha with lunch break in Nairobi. Thereafter proceed with a brief stop at the scenic Great Rift Valley view point.
The Great Rift Valley stretches from the Beqaa Valley in Lebanon which is in Asia to Mozambique in Southeast Africa. It’s a series of contiguous geographic trenches, approximately 6,800 kilometers (4,300 miles) in total length, and much of it is found in Kenya, where it has literally cut the country in two.
The shores host abundant birdlife including pelicans, cormorants, and fish-eagles. There are more animals per acre than any other Kenyan Park, hence many film companies have been to the Island to film the herds of Wildebeest, Waterbuck, Zebra, Buffalo and Gazelle.

Optional visit by boat to the hidden gem, Crescent Island Game Sanctuary which is surrounded by water (it is actually a peninsula). Cost $ 60 per person.

Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_4.destination: Lake Naivasha to Maasai Mara NR Appx: 245 kms - 5 hrs drive
day_4.description:
After early breakfast, we shall then proceed to Maasai Mara Game reserve arriving for lunch.
The reserve is located in South West Kenya, with vast scenic expanse of gently rolling African Savannah plains measuring approximately 1510 square kilometers in area and bordering Serengeti National Park in Tanzania to the south.
It's famous for its spectacular natural diversity of wildlife and happens to be a premier Kenya safari location in East Africa, offering visitors many reasons to visit this animal paradise. Large numbers of Lion, Cheetah, Leopard, Elephant, African Buffalo, Wildebeest, Giraffe, Rhino, Zebra, Gazelle, and many more animals are found in the park in their natural habitat unconfined and free to roam the vast wilderness stretching for miles on end.
We shall have an afternoon game drive.
Later back to the booked lodge for dinner and overnight.

day_5.destination: Maasai Mara
day_5.description:
On this day, you may opt to have the full day game drives or game drives in separate successions so that you may also have a chance to enjoy lodge/camp facilities.
If you opt for the full day game drive, then you will have picnic lunch boxes for the day.

The driver guide shall be readily available to discuss your daily activities as per your preferences.

(Perfect day to undertake optional balloon ride over the plains of Maasai Mara at a fee - $ 480 per person).

Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_6.destination: Maasai Mara to Nairobi - Appx 280 kms 5 to 6 hrs drive
day_6.description:
Early breakfast then check-out and proceed for the morning game viewing drives at the Maasai Mara as you exit the park. Thereafter depart for Nairobi arriving in late afternoon.
Drop off at your hotel/residence/Airport for your onward flight.

name: 3-Day Maasai Mara Group Safari Using - 4x4 Land Cruiser

overview.route_description: Maasai Mara National Reserve is an area of preserved savannah wilderness in southwestern Kenya, along the Tanzanian border. Its animals include lions, cheetahs, elephants, zebras and hippos. Wildebeest traverse its plains during their annual migration. The landscape has grassy plains and rolling hills, and is crossed by the Mara and Talek rivers. The area nearby is dotted with villages (enkangs) of Maasai people. Explore the wilds of Masaai Mara in this 3-day, 2-night safari.

day_1.description:
At 8 o'clock you will be picked up from your Nairobi Hotel and commence the drive to Maasai Mara. You will pass via the great rift valley view point where you will have a stop over of 10 -15 minutes to view the rift valley. Lunch will be at the camp in Maasai Mara. In the afternoon after you check in depart for a sunset evening game viewing drive in the Mara Reserve (4.00 to 6.00 p.m). Return back to the camp for buffet dinner ending with good time for resting at Miti Mingi camp or similar. (The tents have toilet, shower, bed, linen and mosquito nets. Electricity is provided from 6:00 pm to 10:00 pm in the evening. Also from 6:00 am to 8:00 am in the morning).
Masai Mara Reserve is the most popular tourism destination in Kenya. Located in the Great Rift Valley in primarily open grassland. Wildlife is most concentrated on the reserve’s western escarpment. Its regarded as the jewel of Kenya’s wildlife Viewing areas.

day_2.description: At around 7:00 am after breakfast, you will leave for a full day exploring Masai Mara in search of the Big Five and the annual wildebeest’s migration which alone involves over 1.5 million animals arriving in July and departing in November. The phenomenal wildebeest migration which is a spectacular event only seen in Maasai mara is the seventh wonder of the world. At midday, You will have picnic lunch in the park which is provided by us. You will visit the site of the yearly wildebeest migration and see the resident crocodiles and hippos sited at the banks of Mara river, Then continue with the game drive and explore the beauty of the mara reserve until evening.

day_3.description: Early morning breakfast then check out for your drive back to Nairobi while enjoying a short en-route game drive on your way. A simple complimentary lunch will be provided on the way in a travellers motel. On arrival you will be dropped at your Nairobi Hotel. This marks the end of the tour.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 7-Day The Unbeaten Paths of Kenya

overview.route_description: This tour takes you to Aberdare, Samburu, Lake Nakuru and Maasai Mara. With this itinerary, we are eager to show more of Kenyan wildlife and landscapes. All our tours are customisable and flexible to any change. This tour offers bush breakfast and sundowner. We make sure that you are going back home with a handful of African experiences. For more than 2 travellers, kindly contact still there's a window for you.

day_1.destination: Transfer Game Drive: Nairobi to Aberdare National Park
day_1.description:
This is where it all begins, where you join us on the first step of our journey together. You'll meet your friendly expert guide and we'll get the formalities out of the way quickly so that we can get out there and start enjoying the safari you've been dreaming of.
Unlike the parks on Kenya's plains, Aberdare promises you something different. It's a world of dense forests, beautiful waterfalls and unusual highland moors. Wildlife here includes elephants, waterbucks, bushbucks, buffaloes and hyenas, as well as very-hard-to-see black rhinos, black leopards and the much-prized bongo antelope.

We will pick you up at the airport or hotel and start an early morning drive to Aberdare. Keep an eye out for wildlife this morning as our transfer to the next part of your safari doubles as a game drive. The drive is scenic via the central Kenya highlands with 2 stops to view tea and coffee plantations. You will arrive on time for refreshments, dinner and overnight.

day_2.destination: Transfer Game Drive: Aberdare National Park to Samburu National Park
day_2.description:
It's difficult not to fall for Samburu National Reserve, which is one of Kenya's best wildlife parks. There's an excellent chance for you to see all of the big cats here, as well as hyenas, elephants, giraffes, zebras and hippos. Samburu has also played host to over 390 different bird species, not to mention northern species such as reticulated giraffe, beisa oryx, gerenuk and Grevy's zebra. And the natural backdrop is one of the most spectacular in Kenya.

You're in for a treat when you stay at Ashnil Samburu Camp. It's surrounded by doum palms alongside the Ewaso Nyiro River, inside Buffalo Springs Game Reserve but well located for Samburu National Reserve just across the river. Wildlife is everywhere, and the stunning tents are large, have wood floors, and most have stirring views. A swimming pool, bar and restaurant round out a fine package.

After breakfast, we depart to Samburu for an afternoon game drive. Later, you'll be back at your camp for refreshments, dinner and overnight.

day_3.description:
Early Morning Game Drive, Samburu National Reserve.
Put on some warm clothes and enjoy an early morning game drive. This is the perfect time to experience the wildlife and the landscapes they inhabit. The light is soft and warm – perfect for photography – and most animals are out and about, and active. If you’re not an early riser, you’ll definitely want to make an exception here.

All day exploring this amazing game reserve, which will give you a 'refreshment of your mind' as the park is home to the big five (elephant, lion, rhino, leopard, buffalo) as well as Gerenuk, reticulated giraffe, Somali ostrich, Grevy zebra, Besia oryx, and endangered wild dogs as well as the endangered pancake tortoise. There are over 450 species of birds identified and aquatic species in the Waso Nyiro River including, vultures, kingfishers, marabous, bateleurs, guinea fowl, Somali ostriches and others. Later, you'll be back at your camp for refreshments, dinner and overnight.

day_4.destination: Transfer Game Drive: Samburu National Reserve to Lake Nakuru
day_4.description:
You're in for a real treat when you visit Lake Nakuru National Park. It's one of the best places anywhere for seeing both black and white rhinos, but there are other highlights as well, including the possibility of seeing lions (some even climb trees here), leopards, flamingos and endangered Rothschild's giraffes. Rich birdlife, pretty acacia forests, and a towering escarpment overlooking the lake all add to the natural drama.

You'll stay in a corner of Lake Nakuru National Park which Lake Nakuru Sopa Lodge has all to itself. The views from just about anywhere in the lodge are the best in the park, and the rooms are large, lovely and filled with light. The facilities are first-rate, from the swimming pool to the bar and restaurant. But it's the location that really sets this place apart.

After breakfast, we depart to Lake Nakuru. Across the equator, lies the rift valley's famous Lake Nakuru. You'll arrive on time for lunch and then have an afternoon game drive.

day_5.destination: Transfer Game Drive: Lake Nakuru to Maasai Mara Game Reserve
day_5.description:
Welcome to one of the best safari destinations in Kenya. Here in the Masai Mara National Reserve, you're almost certain to see lions, hyenas, hippos, elephants, giraffes, wildebeests, buffaloes, impalas and zebras, not to mention the more than 500 species of birds that have been recorded here. There's also a good chance you'll encounter leopards and cheetahs. Another memorable thing about visiting the Masai Mara is the landscape of vast savannah grasslands with plenty of flat-topped acacia trees. Stay in great comfort in the cottages and safari tents of Mara Leisure Camp, a luxury tented camp that puts you right alongside the Talek River. So many memorable wildlife-viewing experiences are just a short drive away, and the camp has everything you'll need to relax, from a swimming pool and gift shop to a bar and a restaurant.

An early morning drive to Masai Mara. You will arrive in time for lunch and an afternoon game drive. Later, you will back to your camp for dinner and overnight.

day_6.description:
Spend more time exploring the stunning natural landscapes and extraordinary wildlife of the Masai Mara National Reserve.

After breakfast, you'll have the full-day game drive, with packed lunch. The reserve is well known for its black-manned lion, as well as its abundant resident wildlife, and it's one of the few places where it's possible to see the big five during a morning's game drive. Many of the cheetahs are so tame they seek shelter from the hot sun under one's vehicle and several even climb onto the roof to get a better view of prospective prey. For the bird enthusiast, almost 500 species have been recorded: among these 16 species of eagle, plus many hawks and falcons, 6 species of vultures, 8 species of storks 4 of bustard (including the Kori bustard, the world's heaviest flying bird), and 9 species of sunbirds. Later, you'll drive back to your camp for refreshments, dinner and overnight.

Extra optional activities at extra cost:
Hot Air Balloon Safari.
Visit a Maasai Village.

Accommodation is provided in Mid range lodges and tented camps. Meals on safari are on full board basis and bed and breakfast in Nairobi.

Embark on this incredible safari with us.

day_1.description:
At 7.00am you will be picked from your Nairobi hotel or airport by our English speaking guide, who will brief you on the exciting safari you are about to embark on. Depart for Amboseli National Park that is approximately 5 hours from Nairobi. Arrive at Kibo Safari camp in time for check in and lunch. After lunch, relax for a bit as you enjoy the camp's facilities then head for an afternoon game drive till evening.

Dinner and overnight stay at the camp.

day_2.description:
After breakfast you will proceed for a full day game drive with packed lunch or you can choose to go for a morning game drive and return to the camp for lunch, then head out for an afternoon game drive, depending on your preferences. Amboseli national park is a home to a large concentration of wildlife estimated to be 80 different species including African elephant, African buffalo, impalas, lion, zebra, and wildebeest among other African animals, among the animals the park is more famous for habiting is a large population of elephants. The park is also home to over 400 species of birds.

Dinner and overnight stay will be at the camp.

day_3.destination: Amboseli to lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description:
After breakfast you will drive to Nakuru arriving at Flamingo Hill Tented Camp in time for lunch and then have some time to relax.

After lunch you will proceed for an afternoon game drive in the company of an experienced guide who will make your safari memorable.

Lake Nakuru is located in the volcanic zone, and the lake water has a high salinity, which is suitable for the growth of plankton, which are the staple food of flamingos, so it is known as "the paradise of flamingos". Lake Nakuru National Park is a park established to protect avian birds and is known as a "bird-watching paradise". It is also home to hundreds of rhinos, both black and white rhinos and other wildlife such as waterbuck, cape buffalo, hyenas, and hippos.

After the game drive proceed to the camp for dinner and overnight stay.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_4.description:
After breakfast depart to the famous Masai Mara Game Reserve and arrive at Mara Maisha Camp in time for check in and lunch.

Masai Mara National Reserve is an area of preserved savannah wilderness in southwestern Kenya, along the Tanzanian border. Its animals include lions, cheetahs, elephants, zebras and hippos. Wildebeest traverse its plains during their annual migration. The landscape has grassy plains and rolling hills, and is crossed by the Mara and Talek rivers. The area nearby is dotted with villages (enkangs) of Masai people.

After lunch relax a bit at the camp and enjoy its amenities and then proceed for a game drive at 4 o'clock. Get to see different wildlife species including the big five with the help of an experienced guide who will make your safari memorable.

day_5.destination: Game drives in Masai Mara
day_5.description:
On this day you can choose to go on a full-day game drive in the Mara or morning and afternoon game drives. Between the game drives, there is the optional visit to a local Masai village(payments to be made directly) which can be conducted. The trees in the distance might turn out to be a family of giraffes. Those clumps of bushes could be a pride of lions and the rock that moves could be a rhino lumbering out of your way.

You could also encounter a herd of elephants crossing the path in front of you. Large animals are not the only entertainment - a family of warthogs may amuse you, running as fast as their little legs will carry them until they forget why they are rushing and stop to regroup.

You will have dinner and an overnight stay at Mara Maisha Camp.

day_6.description: On this day you will have an early morning game drive and later return to the camp for breakfast. You will then check out and depart for Nairobi through the breathtaking views of the great Rift Valley, having carried beautiful memories of the safari and already looking forward to the next safari. You will be dropped off at the airport for your flight back home.

name: 7-Day The Jewel of Kenya

overview.route_description: The tour takes you to 4 beautiful parks in Kenya especially Amboseli which lies on the floor of Africa's highest Mt. Kilimanjaro. One of Kenya’s most famous parks. Lake Nakuru is best known for its thousands of lesser flamingos nesting along the shores, rich in wildlife viewing. Visit the rolling plains of Masai Mara, where spectacular wildebeest migration happens, and visit Lake Naivasha. The tour offers a boat ride, bush breakfast and sundowner. More than 2 travellers can book this tour.

day_1.destination: Transfer from the Airport to Amboseli National Park
day_1.description:
Your safari starts here, and we're so excited to be here with you. Meet your guide and ask any questions you may have. Then let's go out together and go on the safari you've been waiting for.

You'll be visiting one of the best safari parks in Africa when you come to Amboseli. The park is filled with big-tusked elephants, and Mt Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest mountain (5895m), looms over Amboseli. This combination makes for some fantastic photos, especially when the clouds clear over the summit as they do most days around sunrise and sunset. You also have a good chance of seeing lions, cheetahs, hyenas, zebras, buffaloes, giraffes (out in the park's east), wildebeests and plenty of gazelles. The park is also terrific for birding, with 420 species recorded.

Enjoy transfer game viewing with the immense grandeur of Mt Kilimanjaro in the background. Your lunch will be at Amboseli Serena Safari Lodge. Later, enjoy late afternoon game drive, dinner and overnight stay afterwards.

day_2.description: Spend more time getting to know the magnificent Amboseli National Park. On your guided game drive in Amboseli early this morning, there's a good chance you'll see lots of the animals the park is famous for against a backdrop of Africa's highest mountain, Mount Kilimanjaro. Afterward, return to your lodge for breakfast. You may opt for an additional game drive after breakfast to visit the swamp with its magnificent wildlife presence all day long or relax at your lodge and take in the African wilderness. You'll then go for afternoon game drives in anticipation of seeing the Big Five.

day_3.destination: Transfer Game Drive Amboseli National Park to Lake Nakuru
day_3.description:
Our transfer game drive means that you can look at wildlife even as we take you to your next destination. Lake Nakuru National Park is sure to be one of the highlights of your safari in Kenya. For a start, you'll almost certainly see rhinos (both black and white), lions (including rare tree-climbing lions) and endangered Rothschild's giraffes (which have very pale markings below their knees). Watch also for flamingo, leopard and plenty of birds, all set against a beautiful backdrop of acacia forest, lake and escarpment.

After breakfast, you'll depart towards the Great Rift Valley, viewing scenery and having a stopover at the viewpoint. You'll be arriving at the Pink Lake, often referred to due to the great masses of lesser flamingos. Check in at Sarova Lion Hill Game Lodge, have lunch and proceed for a game drive in Lake Nakuru National Park. During the game drive, you will see the vast numbers of flamingos and water birds that are concentrated along the lakeshore.

day_4.destination: Transfer Game Drive Lake Nakuru National Park to Lake Naivasha
day_4.description:
One of the most beautiful of Kenya's Rift Valley lakes, Lake Naivasha is a pretty place where you're likely to see hippos, and where zebras and giraffes roam the lakeshore. It's a lovely interlude during your safari. There aren't many places to stay where you have to be careful of hippos wandering around the hotel grounds at night. Here at Lake Naivasha Sopa Resort, they're just one of many attractions by the lakeshore, including stone bungalows with luxury rooms, a large swimming pool, a bar and a fine restaurant. Apart from the hippos, watch for waterbuck and other antelopes grazing beneath the many trees.
After breakfast, check out, and have a transfer game drive as you leave the park towards Lake Naivasha, arriving in time for lunch. In the afternoon, you will have the option to enjoy a boat ride at the lake to see the hippos in this freshwater lake and visit Crescent Island. This sanctuary host herbivore like zebras, wildebeests, giraffes, hippos and many more.

day_5.destination: Transfer Game Drive - From Lake Naivasha to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_5.description:
One of our favorite places to look for wildlife in Kenya is the Masai Mara National Reserve. That's because the wildlife here is incredible, with big cats (lions, leopards and cheetahs) and elephants among the highlights. There's a very good chance you'll also see giraffes, buffaloes, wildebeests, zebras, hippos, hyenas, and, of course, impalas. And bring your binoculars, because more than 500 species of birds have been recorded in the reserve. It's a place of beautiful savannah landscapes as well, with lots of acacia trees.
Surrounded by trees and overlooking a bend of the Mara River, Ashnil Mara Camp is a wonderful base while you're in the Masai Mara. There's always lots of wildlife nearby (including crocs and hippos in the river down below), and the safari tents here have wood floors and a real sense of quiet luxury. Enjoy also the swimming pool, massage and spa centre, and the views from the bar and restaurant.
After breakfast, depart to Masai Mara National Reserve.

day_6.destination: Guided Game Drive- Masai Mara National Reserve
day_6.description:
Come with us this morning for a guided game drive. We love showing off the landscapes and wildlife of Masai Mara National Reserve, and part of the excitement is about never quite knowing which animals are going to appear. Enjoy longer in the Masai Mara National Reserve, getting to know its many natural charms.

You'll have a full day at this famous reserve searching for wildlife. You opt to have a picnic lunch or have lunch at the camp.

The Mara is the land of African legend. Lions are abundant throughout the park, as are the elephants, giraffes, a variety of gazelle species and zebras. Cheetahs and leopards are regularly seen.

The annual wildebeest migration is one of nature's few remaining wildlife spectacles, occurring in the Mara from July to September. The big animals and their predators are abundant during this trip.

Optional activities with an extra cost: Masai village visit and Hot Air Ballon safari.

name: 6-Day Amboseli, Lake Nakuru, Masai Mara Road Package

overview.route_description: A 6day road safari encompassing Kenya’s top National Parks and Reserve. See Amboseli National Park, famous for its views of Mount Kilimanjaro and elephants, Lake Nakuru with its diverse wildlife and distinctive lakes, and the world-renowned Masai Mara. This safari is ideal for those want to see the best of Kenya starting from Nairobi head to Amboseli – famous for its views of Mount Kilimanjaro – then through the Great Rift Valley to Lake Nakuru National Park before ending in the Masai Mara.

Additional accommodation before and at the end of the tour can be arranged for an extra cost

day_1.description:
Upon arrival at the Jomo Kenyatta Airport, you will be met by our airport representative and transferred to a city hotel for briefing. Our rep will take you through a brief pre-safari orientation before embarking on your dream safari adventure of Kenya. Proceed on driving southwards to Amboseli. After crossing the frontier town of Namanga, on the border with Tanzania, the semi- desertic landscape brings us to the Amboseli National Park to arrive in time for lunch.

Afternoon game drive includes searching for the Big Five, elephants, Buffalos, lions, Rhinos and leopards and the great view of Mount Kilimanjaro before returning to your lodge as the sun sets! Dinner and overnight - amboseli sopa lodge.
Distance Approx. 250 kms - 5 hrs drive
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_2.description:
Pre-breakfast morning game drive in the reserve, a great opportunity to explore the vast flora and fauna of this magnificent reserve. After a rewarding game drive, return to your lodge for late morning breakfast. Later just relax till afternoon game drive or visit the nearby Maasai village as an optional excursion. Dinner and overnight at amboseli sopa lodge.
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_3.description:
Breakfast and drive to the Lake Nakuru national park. Picnic Lunch in Nairobi and thereafter you descend into the Great Rift Valley where Lake Nakuru is located. The afternoon game drive is included and you will return to your lodge as the sun sets! Dinner and overnight at Lake Nakuru Flamingi Resort or similar.
Distance: Approx. 410 kms - 7 hrs drive

Lake Nakuru is a shallow soda lake, renowned for its huge concentration of flamingos. It is also a Rhino sanctuary. You embark on a game drive which includes a walk on the shores of the lake to view flamingoes from close range. Keep your eyes open for the elusive Leopard or the Tree climbing lions of this park.
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru - Maasai Mara Game Reserve
day_4.description:
After breakfast climb the Western Escarpment of the Rift Valley and head towards Maasai Mara. With its vast open plains and distinctive flat-topped acacia trees, no visit to Kenya would be complete without a visit here.
Enjoying views of the picturesque Maasai tribesmen herding cattle on the way, you arrive in time for lunch and a well deserved rest! Afternoon game drive includes searching for the Big Five, elephants, Buffalos, lions, Rhinos and leopards, before returning to your lodge as the sun sets! Dinner and overnight –Enkorok Mara Camp or similar.
Distance Approx. 310 kms - 6 hrs drive
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_5.destination: Masai Mara Game Reserve
day_5.description:
The early morning calm air of the Maasai Mara has made possible the introduction of Hot Air Balloon flights, available as an optional tour of a hot air balloon ride to see the park from a bird's eye view, from leading lodges and camps in the reserve. (Please reserve early to avoid disappointment for this adventure!). Pre-breakfast morning game drive in the reserve, a great opportunity to explore the vast flora and fauna of this magnificent reserve. After a rewarding game drive, return to your lodge for late morning breakfast. Lunch and late afternoon Game viewing drive.

Option: A full day game drive with picnic lunch boxes (full day game drive including visits to Mara River, Kenya Tanzania Border Post and a great chance to view the "Big Five". You will have picnic lunch at Hippo Pool. Return to your lodge late in the afternoon). Later just relax or visit the nearby Maasai village as an optional excursion. Dinner and overnight – Enkorok Mara Camp
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_6.description:
Depart after breakfast and journey back to Nairobi arriving in time for lunch. Later transferred to the Airport for your departure flight. Distance 270kms 6 hrs drive.
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch}.
