day_1.destination: Nairobi to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_1.description:
You will be picked up from your hotel by our African Paradise safari guide. Head southwards to Masai Mara National Reserve with a stopover at the Great Rift Valley for about 20 minutes. Proceed with your safari to the Mara with another stopover at Narok town. Arrive in time for lunch and some relaxation. Then have an afternoon game drive in the reserve.
Go on an exploratory drive around the 1,792sq km game park with its low hills and savannah-type rolling grasslands, gallery forest on the Mara River, and its tributaries. Get introduced to the herbivores; elephant, rhino, buffalo, a variety of antelope, the Masai giraffe, and the Burchell's zebra. The carnivores are the black-maned lion, cheetah, and leopard. Also to be seen are the largest bird, the Masai ostrich, the secretary bird, the crested crane, and saddle-bill stork. Crocodiles and hippos share the river. Return to your lodge by sunset for dinner and your overnight stay at Miti Mingi Eco Camp (on full board basis).

day_2.destination: Game Drive in Masai Mara National Reserve
day_2.description: Go on an early morning balloon safari ride at US $450.00 per person across the Masai Mara plains (optional). Enjoy breakfast at the lodge, followed by morning and afternoon game drives. Masai Mara is an extension of the Serengeti ecosystem to the south—game abounds here. The Mara is noted for its abundance of lions, particularly the superb black-maned males. See the great migration where over 1.5 million wildebeest and other antelope cross the mighty Mara River. Experience the battle between survival and hunger. You are also likely to see lots of elephants, often in large herds, as well as leopard, cheetah, and rhino. All of the Big Five are residents here and you're sure to see the African buffalo. Get the cameras ready, stock up on film/tapes, and enjoy yourselves! In the evening, visit a Maasai village. Return for dinner and your overnight stay at Miti Mingi Eco Camp (on full board basis).

day_3.destination: Masai Mara to Lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description:
After a hot breakfast is served to you in the camp, depart to Lake Nakuru National Park at around 9:00 am. Drive through another sector of the Great Rift Valley viewpoint. You will pass through Lake Naivasha for your lunch and an optional boat ride (US $25 per person). Afterwards, proceed with your journey to Lake Nakuru.
Lake Nakuru is a small park with over 50% of its area covered by the lake. Located in the middle of the Rift Valley, Lake Nakuru has a wide variety of animals which includes Rothschild's giraffe, lion, white and black rhino, as well as leopard. All these can be spotted depending on your luck. The park is also considered by birdwatchers as an ornithological paradise! A myriad of both greater and lesser flamingoes has made this lake their home. Enjoy dinner and your overnight stay at Citymax Hotel (on full board basis).

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park to Amboseli National Park
day_4.description: You will head to Lake Nakuru National Park for a game drive until 11:00 am. Depart to Masai Mara and have an en-route lunch in Mai Mahiu town. Proceed to Amboseli National Park, where you will arrive in the late afternoon. During your game drive, you will be searching for the big herds of African elephants, cheetahs, lions, gazelles, and the elusive eland. If the weather permits, you will be able to have a magnificent view of Mount Kilimanjaro. Enjoy dinner and your overnight stay at Kimana Camp (on full board basis).

day_5.destination: Game Drive in Amboseli National Park
day_5.description: Today you will go on a full-day exploration of the park. After breakfast, depart on a morning game drive. Return to your lodge for lunch at leisure. Go on an afternoon game drive and return to the lodge for dinner. You will be able to see the peak of Mount Kilimanjaro, the Big Five, and more than 400 bird species. Enjoy dinner and your overnight stay at Kimana Camp (on full board basis).

day_6.destination: Amboseli National Park to Arusha via Namanga Border
day_6.description: After your early breakfast at the lodge, proceed to Tanzania, entering through the Namanga border. When you are done with the immigration formalities, you will be connected to a shuttle bus to Arusha (1hr 20min drive). You will be picked up by our company vehicle and transferred to the hotel for lunch. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Arusha Tourist Inn Hotel.

name: 9-Day Kenya and Tanzania Safari Combine

overview.route_description: Enjoy 9 days safari featuring Kenya and Tanzania, the tour starts and ends in Nairobi. You will visit Lake Nakuru, Masai Mara National Reserve, Serengeti, Ngorongoro Crater and Amboseli National Park. Dinner and your overnight stay will be at mid-range tented camps and safari lodges.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Lake Nakuru National Park
day_1.description: Leave your Nairobi Hotel early in the morning and drive to Lake Nakuru National Park. Arrive in Nakuru and check in at your booked lodge in time for lunch. Go for the afternoon game drive in search of the lions, flamingos, white rhinos and many more. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Lake Nakuru Sopa Lodge.

day_2.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_2.description: Leave early in the morning and drive to Masai Mara National Reserve for 6 hours with packed lunches. Arrive in time for the afternoon game drive. Enjoy a game drive inside the park. Enjoy the scenery and abundance of wildlife in the reserve. You'll then return at the camp for dinner and your overnight stay at Masai Mara Sopa Lodge.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve Game Drive
day_3.description: Spend the day in Masai Mara, a game sanctuary where you will have the best opportunity of spotting the Big Five—lion, leopard, buffalo, rhino and elephant. You will drive to the famous Mara River where the crossing of the wildebeests takes place. Enjoy a game drive inside the park. Take your lunch along Mara River then proceed with the game drive. Return to the lodge for dinner and your overnight at Mara Sopa Lodge.

day_4.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve to Serengeti National Park
day_4.description: After breakfast from the camp, depart Masai Mara with en route game drives to the Kenya /Tanzania border of Isebania, 5 hours drive. After clearing with immigration and changing vehicles, proceed to Serengeti National Park arriving for the afternoon game drive en route. In the evening, arrive at the camp for check-in. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Serengeti Tortillis Camp.

day_5.destination: Serengeti National Park Game Drive
day_5.description: After breakfast from the lodge with a picnic lunch, enjoy a game drive in Central Serengeti. Descend into the heart of wild Africa the Serengeti National Park—with its endless plains, rolling into the distance as far as the eye can see. Drive past kopjes where lions, cheetahs, and leopards like to rest. Enjoy the game drive inside the park and expect to see predator actions, elephants, leopards, impalas, zebras, and different bird species. In the evening, drive out of the park for dinner and your overnight stay at Serengeti Tortillis Tented Camp.

day_6.description: After breakfast with a picnic lunch, depart to Ngorongoro for 3 hours. Upon arrival, descend on a narrow and steep road to the crater floor with a picnic lunch. The crater is inhabited by a spectacular array of wildlife, which includes zebras, hippos, hyenas, wildebeests, warthogs and the famous “Big Five”—buffalo, rhino, lion, elephant and leopard. After extensive game viewing and lunch at a picnic spot, you will leave the crater and travel to Karatu for your overnight at Farm of Dreams Lodge.

name: 7-Day Classic Top Kenya Safari

overview.route_description: This 7 Days safari package will take you to Aberdare, Lake Nakuru, Lake Naivasha and Maasai Mara National Park. Picturesque, steep forested ravines and open moorland characterize the Aberdare National Park. On the floor of the Great Rift Valley, surrounded by wooded and bushy grassland, lies the beautiful Lake Nakuru National Park. A visit to Masai Mara National Reserve will give you a guarantee to watch animals in the most concentrated animal areas in Kenya.

day_1.description: Pick up hotel/airport and leave for Aberdare National Park to arrive in good time for lunch and rest. In the afternoon, enjoy close range game view from your balcony at the lodge. The Ark lodge offers high altitude game viewing, including animals that are rarely encountered elsewhere: giant forest hog, bush pig, tree hyrax, large spotted genet, and the elusive bongo. Wildlife can be observed from the balcony or inside your rooms where you can see, hear and smell the nature at its best. You can put in a request to be awakened during the night if your favorite animals show up. A herd of Elephants might be just feet away and if you are lucky, a Leopard or Lion might put in an appearance. Dinner and overnight at the lodge.

day_2.description:
After breakfast, leave with game drive enroute to Lake Nakuru National park to arrive in good time for lunch and rest. You will have a stopover en-route at Thomson’s Falls.

Thomson's Falls - Located in a dense forest populated by baboons, Thomson's Falls plummet from a height of 72 m (230 ft). Stay at the bottom if you don't mind getting splashed by the foaming water-looking up at the falls and the surrounding cliffs provides an opportunity to spot the resident baboons. You’ll have the opportunity to view Mt. Kenya on the way and stop at the equator line for photos and some geography explanation about the two hemispheres and how this imaginary line affects them. In the afternoon, head for game drive around the Lake: best time to see the big cats and many heard of buffaloes. You will also spot black and white rhino. Dinner and overnight at the lodge.

day_3.description: After breakfast, we go by road to Lake Naivasha. The drive via farming country and local homesteads via the Great Rift Valley escarpment floor is scenic. We arrive for a relaxing walk Safari through Hell's Gate National Park and enjoy the geothermal tower. Here you will spend a delightful day exploring the extra ordinary bird life for which Lake Naivasha is internationally renowned. Others game include Thomson’s and Grant gazelle, the long-eared leaf-nosed bat, colobus monkey, rock hyrax, hippo, and waterbuck; Impala, striped hyena, bat-eared fox, wildcat, reedbuck and golden cat.

day_4.destination: Maasai Mara
day_4.description: After breakfast, you will drive to Masai Mara National park. Arrive in time for lunch and in the afternoon, go for a game drive where you may spot animals like the Zebra, Grant’s gazelle, wildebeests and other wildlife. Return back to the camp for overnight stay.

day_5.destination: Maasai Mara
day_5.description: After breakfast at 0700 am, we enter the park for the whole day exploring Maasai Mara. Over 450 species of animals have been recorded here. We will easily see lions, rhinos, hippos, crocodiles, giraffe, wildebeests, zebras, buffalo, warthogs, hyenas, jackals, wild dogs, leopard, elephants, and many kinds of antelopes. We will have the opportunity of spotting the BIG FIVE including lion, elephant, leopard, rhino and buffalo. We will have picnic lunch boxes to spend the entire whole day in the park so that we discover the beauty and explore the Mara. (Optional excursions available: hot air balloon or visit a Masai tribal village).

day_6.description: Another day full of wildlife viewing drives. You may choose to have the full day game drives or game drives in separate sessions so that you may also have a chance to enjoy lodge/camp facilities. The driver guide shall be readily available to discuss your daily activities depending on your preferences. It is also an opportunity to experience a hot air balloon ride and float over the Masai Mara plains as you watch game (extra cost).

name: 7-Day Mid-Range Bush and Beach Adventure

overview.route_description: This safari will allow you to enjoy bush experience in three major Kenyan parks thereafter, heading to the coastal sandy beaches of Mombasa. The never ending excitement of your Kenyan bush safari leaves you feeling exhausted and desiring a more relaxed place. The Kenyan coast is a superb location to rejuvenate before returning home. A coastal gate away to Mombasa takes you to a majestic tropical paradise of blue-green waters lapping at long soft sand beaches leaving you yearning for more.

day_1.description: Your driver-guide reports to your hotel for start of the safari, with a departure for a picturesque drive descending the Great Rift Valley and onwards to Masai Mara, Kenya's famous game reserve. Stop briefly en route at the Great Rift Valley view point to enjoy the stunning views of an enormous valley system said to be visible from the outer space. Arrive in Maasai Mara in time for lunch. After lunch embark on an afternoon game drive which will allow spotting of the magnificent wildlife in the park.  Bordering Tanzania, the Mara is in the northern extension of Serengeti and forms a wildlife corridor between the two countries. Dinner and overnight will be at Sentrim Mara.

day_2.description:
Enjoy a full day in this phenomenal reserve. One of the most iconic wildlife regions in Africa. You’ll have excellent opportunities to spot some of Africa's most notable species such as lions, elephants, giraffes, leopards, cheetahs and many more.
We can also arrange for a stunning hot air balloon safari over the Masai Mara at an extra cost. Just ask us our friendly guide about these fantastic extras, to add some truly intimate touches to your Kenya safari experience. To get some of the best game viewing of the day, an early start is needed to beat the heat of the sun. This is the time that the big cats are most active and can provide some of the most dramatic photography, thanks to the beautiful lighting. Dinner and overnight will be at the camp.

day_3.destination: Maasai Mara Natioal Reserve-Lake Nakuru Natioanal Park
day_3.description: After breakfast depart from the Mara through the Maasai plains and the Mau escarpments into the floor of the Rift valley. Arrive in the flamingo fringed Lake Nakuru National Park in time for lunch and afternoon game drive. We will embark on a comprehensive game drive of this scenic park including visits to viewpoints which offer superb photo opportunities. Lake Nakuru is one of several Rift Valley lakes and its ecosystem supports a wide ecological diversity with Flamingos (Greater and Lesser) and other water birds being the major attractions of the area. The ecosystem provides for about 56 different species of mammals including the white rhino and buffaloes and a variety of terrestrial birds numbering nearly 450 species. Dinner and overnight stay will be at Sentrim Elementaita.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park-Amboseli National Park
day_4.description: We will depart early in the morning after breakfast towards Amboseli National Park with lunch en route. Your guide will take you on an afternoon game drive. Amboseli is synonymous with two particular things – majestic herds of elephant and glorious views of Mount Kilimanjaro. Located at the foot of Mount Kilimanjaro, the tallest mountain in Africa, Amboseli National Park is one of the most popular parks in Kenya. One of the best places in Africa to view large herds of elephants up-close. On a clear evening you can catch a view of the magnificent Mount Kilimanjaro. Also to be found in the Amboseli are herds of wildebeest, buffaloes, gazelles and many other wildlife. Lions and cheetahs can also be seen here Dinner and overnight at Sentrim Amboseli.

day_5.destination: Amboseli NP-Mombasa Beach
day_5.description: An early morning game drive followed by a hearty breakfast then check out of the camp. Leave for Emali Train Station where you will board your train to Mombasa. You will be picked by our representative at the Mombasa train station for a transfer to your beach resort where you will spend your beach holiday.

day_6.description: In the morning after breakfast at the resort, you have an option of going for a tour or spend time on the warm sandy beaches. The Kenyan coastline is a superb location to rejuvenate before returning home. It takes you to a majestic tropical paradise of blue-green waters lapping at long soft sand beaches with so much to offer. With almost seventeen kilometres of pristine white sand, cerulean water, and waving palm trees, this picture-perfect beach hugs the shores of the warm Indian Ocean. There are coral reefs to explore, and the sand bars make it perfect for swimming and many other water sports.

name: 7-Day Safari Kenya & Tanzania

overview.route_description: For seven days safari, we recommend a visit to Amboseli, Tarangire National Park, Ngorongoro crater and Lake Manyara. Here's a sneak peek of these two incredible parks. Tarangire National Park is located south of Lake Manyara. The river from which the park takes its name is of the primary source of water for the local wildlife, making it the perfect place to spot large concentrations of animals. Ngorongoro Crater is a natural paradise and is considered one of the Seven Natural Wonders of Africa.

day_1.destination: Jomo Kenyatta International Airport - After 40 Hotel
day_1.description: One of our guides will welcome you at the Jommo Kenyatta International Airport and drive you to your accommodation in Nairobi, where you will be able to refresh here you will prepare for your safari starting the following day and paperwork at office. Overnight stay at After 40 Hotel.

day_2.description: Today after the breakfast you will be picked and drive from your Lodge to Amboseli National Park. Amboseli National Park is in southern Kenya. It’s known for its large elephant herds, the name “Amboseli” comes from a Maasai word meaning “salty dust”, and it is one of the best places in Africa to view large herds of elephants up close. Nature lovers can explore five different habitats here ranging from the dried-up bed of Lake Amboseli, wetlands with sulphur springs, the savannah and woodlands. Stop by at the local Maasai community who live around the Park and experience their authentic culture. You will then drive back to your Lodge for overnight stay.

day_3.description: After breakfast, with picnic lunch box you proceed with drive in Amboseli national and enjoy game drive in Amboseli. It’s known for its large elephant herds, the name “Amboseli” comes from a Maasai word meaning “salty dust”, and it is one of the best places in Africa to view large herds of elephants up close. Nature lovers can explore five different habitats here ranging from the dried-up bed of Lake Amboseli, wetlands, springs, the savannah and woodlands. Stop by at the local Maasai community who live around the Park and experience their authentic culture. You will thereafter drive back to your Lodge for overnight stay.

day_4.destination: Amboseli to Arusha
day_4.description:
Amboseli - Namanga Border
Wake up at 0630hrs for early morning game drive in Amboseli. Return to your accommodation for late breakfast, then at 1000hrs check out and drive while spotting game on the way towards exit gate drive to Namanga border where our vehicle is waiting for you. After border formalities switch cars and drive to Arusha for a later lunch. Overnight stay at Villa Poa.

day_5.destination: Tarangire National Park
day_5.description: Starting at your accommodation around 8:00 am, you will receive a short briefing about the safari and then depart to the National Park. The Tarangire National Park is located South of Lake Manyara. The river from which the park takes its name is the primary source of water for the local wildlife, making it the perfect place to spot large concentration of animals like elephants (largest concentration in the country), wildebeests and zebras. Big cats are also frequent in the dry season, and the abundance of baobab trees will surely make it possible for you to collect amazing African postcards. Lunch will take place at a picnic place overlooking the Tarangire river, and after more game viewing in the Park we will drive to Karatu are for overnight stay at Eileen's Trees Inn.

day_6.description: Start early in the day to visit the Ngorongoro Crater, the world’s largest inactive, intact and unfilled volcanic caldera, formed when a huge volcano exploded and collapsed on itself. In the present days, however, far from being a destructive source of hot lava, it’s actually a natural paradise considered one of the Seven Natural Wonders of Africa, home to nearly 25 000 large animals, including black rhinoceros, buffaloes, hippos and big cats. The Park is also classed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The tour will stop for lunch at a picnic place near a lake, and continue in the afternoon. Later on you will drive back for overnight stay at Eileen's Trees Inn.

name: 9-Day Safari (Including Masai Mara) & Zanzibar Extension

overview.route_description: This is a 6-day amazing safari with the best of Kenya. Amboseli is the best park in the whole of Africa with stunning views of the Kilimanjaro and Lake Naivasha a unique place where you can do a boat ride among the hippos. Mara is one of the best parks in the world where you can spot the Big Five and witness the Great Migration between July and October. Finally, you can relax and enjoy 3 days in Zanzibar with amazing landscapes.

day_1.description: After pickup from the airport, you'll have an early morning start and drive to Amboseli National Park. Check in at your accommodation for lunch. In the afternoon, enjoy a game drive. Amboseli National Park is situated due south of Nairobi. Most of the park consists of a dry, ancient lake bed and fragile grassland with patches of acacia woodland, while in the southern area there is a number of small, rocky, volcanic hills. Around the swamps Ol Kenya, Ol Tukai and Enkongo Narok, the vegetation is lush with yellow-barked acacias and phoenix palms.

day_2.description: You will rise up early for good views of Mount Kilimanjaro before the clouds build up over the summit with packed lunch provided. An optional visit to a Maasai village can be planned after breakfast. The visit reveals the singing and dancing that are part of their daily lives and sacred rituals. A glimpse into their homes and social structure is a poignant experience. Despite its changing habitat, Amboseli National Park is possibly the best wildlife area in the whole of Africa to experience elephants at close range. Unharassed by poachers, elephants feeding and bathing in the swamps must form the highlights of any safari.

day_3.description:
You'll have an early morning drive to Lake Naivasha. It is the highest and the most beautiful of the Rif Valley lakes. At 1910 m (6200 ft), the water is fresh and the lake is fringed with dense clumps of papyrus (ancient Egyptian once used this to make paper). Kingfishers use the papyrus as a perch, herons hide in it while searching for food.

Lake Naivasha is yet another area popular for bird watching (over 400 species have been recorded). It is also a favourite weekend retreat for Nairobi residents, who come here to sail, water ski and fish. There are no crocodiles in the lake as the water is too cold for them, due to altitude but there are a number of hippos. Along the lakeshore, vineyards produce grapes for the country's fledgeling wine industry.

day_4.destination: Lake Naivasha/Masai Mara National Reserve
day_4.description: You'll depart early in the morning to Masai Mara National Reserve. Arrive in time for lunch then have an afternoon game drive. Mara holds on as one of the few places on earth where wildlife still lives comparatively undisturbed, in the numbers that once roamed the plains and forests of Africa. As the northern tip of the vast Serengeti ecosystem, the Mara hosts the spectacular seasonal migration of many thousands of wildebeest, zebras and attendant predators.

day_5.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve
day_5.description:
After breakfast, we will have a full day game drive, with packed lunch provided. The reserve is well known for its black-manned lion, as well as its abundant resident wildlife. It is one of the few places where it's possible to see the Big Five during a morning game drive.

Many of the cheetahs are so tame they seek shelter from the hot sun under one's vehicle and several even climb onto the roof to get a better view of prospective prey. For the bird enthusiast, almost 500 species have been recorded: among these 16 species of eagle, plus many hawks and falcons, 6 species of vultures, 8 species of storks 4 of bustard (including the kori bustard, the world's heaviest flying bird), and 9 species of sunbirds.

day_6.description: You'll have a morning game drive in Masai Mara and depart late in the morning for Zanzibar. You'll spend three days relaxing and have a memorable and fun vacation with amazing and beautiful landscapes. Lunch will be en-route and in the afternoon catch a flight from Nairobi to Zanzibar.

name: 10-Day Luxury Kenya & Tanzania Safari

overview.route_description: This tour spends five days in Kenya (Lake Naivasha and Masai Mara) and five days in Tanzania (Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro, and Manyara). You will transfer from Masai Mara to the Serengeti through the Isebania Border. At the end of the tour you may opt to to transfer to Amboseli for one or two nights and then finish the tour in Nairobi (as opposed to ending the tour in Arusha). This tour can also be done in the opposite order (starting in Arusha).

day_1.description:
After an early morning pick-up, you will drive to Lake Nakuru National Park. Lake Nakuru lies across the equator and southward of Bogoria in the Great Rift Valley. It is known all over the world for its flamingos and is recognized as being one of the natural wonders of the world.

Lake Nakuru is also a rhino sanctuary, harboring a population of over 40 black and over 60 white rhinos. It is the flamingos, of course, that have always been the main attraction. There may be almost two million flamingos in residence at any given time, forming a stunningly beautiful deep pink band around the edge of the lakeshore. You will arrive in time for lunch and an afternoon game drive. Dinner and your overnight stay will be at a campsite or lodge.

Note: Accommodations can be upgraded to higher level options or downgraded to more budget friendly options (price reduction).

day_2.description:
Start the day with a morning drive to Masai Mara National Reserve. This is one of the few places left on earth where wildlife still lives comparatively undisturbed in the numbers that were once common across all the plains and forests of Africa. As the northern tip of the vast Serengeti ecosystem, the Mara hosts the spectacular seasonal migration of many thousands of wildebeest, zebras, and attendant predators. You will arrive in time for lunch followed by an afternoon game drive.

Note: Accommodations can be upgraded to higher level options or downgraded to more budget friendly options (price reduction).

day_3.description:
After breakfast, we have a full day game drive in the Masai Mara (lunch will be a picnic). The reserve is well known for its black-maned lions and abundant wildlife. This is one of the few places where it's possible to see the big five during a morning game drive. Many of the cheetahs are so tame they seek shelter from the hot sun under vehicles. Several even climb onto the roof to get a better view of prospective prey!

For the bird enthusiasts - almost 500 species have been recorded here. Among these include 16 species of eagle, many hawks and falcons, six species of vultures, eight species of storks, four species of bustard (including the Kori bustard, the world's heaviest flying bird), and nine species of sunbirds.

Note: Accommodations can be upgraded to higher level options or downgraded to more economic ones (price reduction).

day_4.destination: Masai Mara - Serengeti
day_4.description:
Today you will transfer from the Masai Mara to Serengeti National Park via the Isebania border crossing. This transfer will take the majority of the day, but you will get to enjoy a game drive for most of it.

In the afternoon you will game drive en-route to your tented camp. Evening game drives are also available.

Note: Accommodations can be upgraded to higher level options or downgraded to more economic ones (price reduction).

day_5.destination: Serengeti National Park
day_5.description:
As you crest the hillside, the vast Serengeti spreads out before you as far as the eyes can see. Serengeti means "endless plains" in Kiswahili. This 6,900 sq. mile (18,000 sq. km) park is inhabited by more than two million large animals, including more than a million wildebeest, hundreds of thousands of plains zebras, and Thomson's gazelles. Large predators, including lions, cheetahs, and hyenas, are drawn to the area by the abundance of prey that migrates throughout the park. Many smaller animals such as rock hyrax, bat-eared foxes, mongoose, honey badger, jackals, monkeys, baboons, and African hares also inhabit the area, along with nearly 500 species of birds.

You will spend the second day on morning and afternoon game drives in the Serengeti.

You have the option to add-on a visit to Olduvai Gorge or a hot air balloon flight. Accommodations can be upgraded to higher level options or downgraded to more economic ones (price reduction).

day_6.description:
Today you will wake up very early for a pre-breakfast safari. The animals are more active at this time - and you get to witness a fantastic sunrise! The sunrise on the African savannah is one of the most beautiful experiences one can have. After the game drive you will return to the camp for brunch.

In the afternoon we will transfer to Ngorongoro, the eighth natural wonder of the world. With walls 2,000 ft high and a crater floor that spreads for 102 sq. miles, the crater is a virtual Noah's Ark. It is inhabited by almost every species of wildlife indigenous to East Africa, including the rare black rhino. The crater has the greatest concentration of wildlife on the planet. The large bull elephants that reside here have extremely large tusks due to the rich mineral content of the volcanic soil and its grasses.

You have the option of going on an afternoon walking safari in the Ngorongoro highlands. Accommodations can be upgraded or downgraded.

name: 12-Day Kenya Tanzania Budget Joining Safari

overview.route_description: Want to explore East Africa destinations? If yes, our budget Kenya-Tanzania wildlife and cultural tour will give you an opportunity to learn the culture of the ethnic community, flora and fauna of the region. You will be able to explore abundant wildlife, all the Big Five, beautiful landscapes and meadows of the Mara River. You will be visiting Nairobi, Masai Mara, Lake Nakuru National Park, Amboseli National Park, Arusha town, Tarangire National Park, Serengeti NP and Ngorongoro Crater.

day_1.description: On your arrival at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport, you will be met and picked by an African Paradise Safaris guide and you will be transferred to your city hotel for rest and leisure. Depending on arrival time, you can have a city tour. Your accommodation is in Ibis Hotel on a bed and breakfast basis.

day_2.destination: Nairobi to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_2.description:
After breakfast at the hotel, you will be picked by the driver and head southwards to Masai Mara National Reserve. Arrive in time for lunch and relax. Later, have an afternoon game drive in the reserve.
Enjoy an exploratory drive around the 1,792sq km game park with its low hills and savannah type rolling grasslands, gallery forest on the Mara River and its tributaries. Get introduced to the herbivores; elephant, rhino, buffalo, and the variety of antelopes, the Masai giraffe and the Burchell zebra. The carnivores are the black mane lion, cheetah and leopard. Also to be seen are the largest birds, the Masai ostrich, the Secretary bird, the crested crane and saddle-bill stork. Crocodiles and hippos share the river. You'll return to your lodge by sunset. Dinner and your overnight stay will be at Miti Mingi Eco Camp on a full board basis.

day_3.description:
You'll have an optional early morning balloon safari ride (US$450.00 per person ) across the Masai Mara plain.
Have breakfast at the lodge then enjoy morning and afternoon game drives. Masai Mara is an extension of the Serengeti ecosystem to the south. Game abounds here. The Mara is noted for its abundance of lions, particularly the superb black maned males. See the great migration where over 1.5 million wildebeest and other antelopes cross the mighty Mara River. Experience the battle between survival and hunger. You are also likely to see lots of elephants here often in large herds. If you're lucky, you'll see leopard, cheetah and rhino. All of the Big Five are residents. You're sure to see the African buffalo. Get the cameras ready, stock up on film/tapes and enjoy yourselves! In the evening, visit a Maasai village. Dinner and your overnight stay will be at Miti Mingi Eco Camp ( on full board basis).

day_4.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve to Lake Nakuru National Park
day_4.description:
You'll be woken by marching elephants and the sounds of birds. Have breakfast at your lodge. Check out and drive through the cool Rift Valley environment towards Nakuru. Drive through the park and arrive at your camp in time for lunch. Afterwards, have an afternoon game drive at Lake Nakuru National Park.
L. Nakuru is a small park with over 50% of its area covered by the Lake. Located in the middle of the Rift Valley, L. Nakuru has a wide variety of animals which includes the Rothschild giraffe, lions, white and black rhinos as well as leopards. All these can be spotted depending on your luck. The park is also considered by birdwatchers as an ornithological paradise! A myriad of both greater and lesser flamingoes have made this lake their home. Dinner and your overnight stay will be at Citymax Hotel (on full board basis).

day_5.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park to Amboseli National Park
day_5.description:
You'll have a hot breakfast at the hotel. At 8.30 am, drive to Amboseli National Park where you will arrive in time for lunch. After lunch, proceed for an afternoon game drive then return to the lodge for dinner and your overnight stay. During your game drive, you will be searching for the big herds of African elephants, cheetahs, lions, gazelles and the elusive elands. If the weather permits, you will be able to have a magnificent view of Mt. Kilimanjaro. All meals and your overnight stay will be at Kimana Camp.
(Meal plan: Full board).

day_6.description: You'll have a full day exploration of the park. After breakfast, depart for the morning game drive. You'll then be transferred to your lodge for lunch at leisure. Embark an afternoon game drive. Later, you will return to the lodge for dinner. You will be able to see the peak of Mt Kilimanjaro, the Big Five and more than 400 birds species. All meals and your overnight stay will be at Kimana Camp (Meal plan: Full board).

name: ½-Day Hotel to Airport Transfer with Wildlife Tour

overview.route_description: Checking out of the hotel with ample time before you catch your flight? You can utilize that time to visit Nairobi national park before being transferred to the airport. With its unique status as the only park within a capital city in the world, you can enjoy the abundant birdlife of over 400 species and catch sight of four out of five Big Five animals.

day_1.description:

Pick up and free transfers
Transferred to the airport at no extra.

Duration
The mini safari will last between 2hrs and 4hrs at the park. The timings can also be fine tuned according to a travelers need.

Transport
Transport and game drives by customized safari van with pop up roof.

Nairobi national park tour itinerary
You will be picked from the hotel and driven to Nariobi National Park. Nairobi National Park has abundant wildlife. There are over 100 species of mammals and reptiles, and more than 400 species of birds. It is possible to see the big four of the big five here and they are the Lion, Leopard, Rhino and Buffalo. One of the key places to visit is the ivory burning site where elephant tusks and rhino horns have been torched by Kenyan presidents to show the country’s commitment to stop poaching. You will also be driven around in search of the parks diverse wildlife.

After the tour, you will be taken to the airport.

day_2.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

overview.route_description: Amboseli National Park is one of the most spectacular national parks that offer a wide range of different animal species that include lions, cheetahs, big herds of elephants, wildebeests, zebras and many more. This is also the perfect destination for Ornithologists! There is a lot of Birdlife including flamingos, pelicans, Jacanna and other migrant species. Mount Kilimanjaro sitting majestically to the south gives you the whole concept of not wanting to miss this amazing safari.

day_1.description:
You will be met by the Lion Rider Tours and Safaris representative for the safari briefing and they will hand you over to your experienced safari guide who will drive you safely to Amboseli National Park. Our guides are trained in all aspects of guiding techniques, customer care, and first aid. This makes all our clients feel very safe throughout the safari. You will arrive at your lodge for lunch. At 3:30 pm, depart for the afternoon game drive expecting to see lions, big herds of elephants, wildebeests, zebras and many more animals until sunset.
Dinner and your overnight stay are at AA Lodge.

day_2.description:
At 7:00 am, depart for a morning game drive with packed lunch boxes. This enables you to spend more time viewing wildlife in the park. The food and services are excellent. I have never heard any complaints from our guests before. Proceed with the game drives until sunset.
Dinner and your overnight stay are at AA Lodge.

day_3.description:
At 6:00 am, depart for an early morning game drive. At 9:00 am return to the lodge for breakfast. At 10:00 am, check out and drive back to Nairobi in the evening.
You will be dropped off at the hotel or airport.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 5-Day Amboseli, Tsavo West & Salt Lick Mid- Range Safari

overview.route_description: This tour takes us to Amboseli National Park Amboseli where you get up close to free-ranging elephants, rich wildlife and birdlife. After proceed to Tsavo West National Park is known for bird life, large mammal’s and natural springs. We then take you to Salt Lick Safari Lodge Lodge which has been one of Kenya’s flagship lodges, famed for being among the World’s Most Photographed Lodges. It is a set in Taita Hills Wildlife Sanctuary overlooking a waterhole. Drop of will be at the Kenyan Coast.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Amboseli Appx: 250 kms -5 hrs drive
day_1.description:
Depart for the Amboseli National Park via the Nairobi-Mombasa Road. The morning drive is via typical African savanna country dotted with local homesteads and colorful Maasai herdsmen grazing their cattle.
Arrive in time for lunch and later venture into the park for the scheduled afternoon game viewing drive.
You will spot the free-ranging herds of elephants up close in the park – a little wonder why the park is the best place in Africa to spot such herds. It is home to many other species such as the Cape buffalo, Impala, Lion, Cheetah, Spotted hyena, Maasai giraffe, Zebra and Blue wildebeest among other African animals. Birdlife is also abundant, both large and small species. Weather permitting, Amboseli national park offers a beautiful vista of the scenic snow-capped Mt. Kilimanjaro which makes it a perfect site for photography. It is the tallest mountain in Africa and the highest free-standing mountain in the world.
Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_2.description:
Another day to enjoy full day game viewing extravaganza in Amboseli. With its reputation for active elephant sighting it’s easy to spot them roaming the plains in the morning and evenings. And during much of the day you can observe them splashing and foraging in Ol Okenya Swamp.
We shall also stop at the observation hill to view the sprawling breath-taking view of Amboseli.
You may opt to have the full day game drives or game drives in separate successions so that you may also have a chance to enjoy lodge facilities.
The driver guide shall be readily available to discuss your daily activities as per your preferences including an optional visit to a Maasai village at an extra cost.
Every safari is different according to your wishes, likes and expectations. Just let us know how you would like to customize your special journey.
Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_3.destination: Amboseli to Tsavo West National Park Appx: 110 kms 2 hrs drive
day_3.description:
Early breakfast then check-out and proceed to Tsavo West National Park commonly known as “Land of Lava, Springs, Man-Eaters & Magical Sunsets”.
From the sight of fifty million gallons of crystal-clear water gushing out from the under parched lava rock that is the Mzima Springs, to the Shetani lava flows, Tsavo West is a beautiful, rugged wilderness. The savannah ecosystem comprises of open grasslands, scrublands, and Acacia woodlands, belts of riverine vegetation and rocky ridges including the Poacher's Lookout where visitors can see the teeming herds in the plains below.
Tsavo West offers some of the most magnificent game viewing in the world. The attractions include elephant, rhino, Hippos, lions, cheetah, leopards, Buffalos, diverse plant and bird species including the threatened corncrake and near threatened Basra Reed Warbler.
Arrival for lunch, followed by afternoon game drive.
Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_4.destination: Tsavo West to Taita Hills Wildlife Sanctuary Appx 130km : 2hrs 30min drive
day_4.description:
After we breakfast, you will depart with an en-route game viewing drive for Taita Hills Wildlife Sanctuary. The sanctuary hosts over 50 larger mammals that include elephants, zebras, cape buffaloes, giraffes, lions, leopards, cheetahs, varied antelopes and an array of over 390 bird species.
Your stay will be at Salt Lick Safari Lodge, favorite amongst many travelers. The Lodge overlooks a waterhole and linked by suspended walkways. At night, the waterholes are floodlit ensuring that you enjoy an uninterrupted view of the numerous animals arriving to quench their thirst. The elevated restaurant, and the bar a level higher, also offer stunning views of the sanctuary and are the ideal vantage points to view game.
The neighbouring Taita Hills Safari Resort & Spa has a museum that displays some of the World War 1 memorabilia as part of the rich history of Taita Taveta County.
Arrival in good time for lunch.
Later have an afternoon game drive then back to the lodge for dinner and overnight.

day_5.destination: Taita Hills Wildlife Sanctuary to your drop off point at Kenyan Coast Appx: 200kms 4-5hrs drive
day_5.description:
On this day after breakfast, we exit the Sanctuary with game viewing en-route and proceed to drop you at your preferred location along our beautiful Kenyan Coast.
This can be within Mombasa town, North Coast or even South Coast. Your beach holiday can be arranged separately, do let us know accordingly while booking this Safari and we will be glad to guide you accordingly.
Arrival will be in late afternoon.

day_6.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 4-Day Exotic Masai Mara and Lake Nakuru Safari

overview.route_description: Adventure covers both wildlife and geographic destinations like Great Rift Valley. It’s one of the best tour packages to do for a 4 days period. You will explore the Masai Mara National Reserve for 2 nights for a first class game viewing experience of the great wildebeest migration if in season and later visit Lake Nakuru National Park for a chance to view the rare white rhinos and flamingos amidst a variety of other bird species.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Masai Mara Game Reserve
day_1.description: This morning we pick up you from your hotel and we depart from Nairobi at 8.30 am and drive through the view point of the Great Rift Valley to the Masai Mara National Reserve. This enormous reserve is actually part of the vast Serengeti plains famously known for its spectacular great wildebeest’s migration and is home of the Big Five: Lion, Elephant, Leopard, Buffalo and Rhino. Lunch at the Lodge and relax before departing for the afternoon game drive. The Mara Game Reserve is one of the greatest wildernesses of the world. Large mammals are varied, and easy to see. The wild animals found in the Park’s are: Masai Giraffe, Buffalo, Eland and thousands of plain game including Impala, Zebra, both Thomson’s and grants Gazelles. Dinner and Overnight at the lodge.

day_2.description: Full day spent for viewing the great predators and explore the parks amazingly high concentration of wild animals. On the plains are enormous herds of grazing animals plus the elusive Cheetah and leopard hiding amidst acacia boughs. During the stay we also have an optional opportunity to visit a village of the Masai people to witness the singing and dancing that are part of their daily lives and sacred rituals. A glimpse into their homes and social structure is a poignant experience. Dinner and overnight at lodge.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara To Lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description: Early morning game drive. Then return to the lodge for the breakfast and depart for Lake Nakuru National park located in the Great Rift Valley. After lunch an exciting game drive until 6.30 in the evening. The Park is a home to stunning flocks of lesser and Greater Flamingos, which literally turn the lakeshores in to a magnificent pink stretch. The bird life here is world renown and over 400 birds’s species exist here, White Pelicans, Plovers, Egrets and Marabou Stork. It is also one of the very few places in Africa to see the White and Black Rhino and rare Rothschild Giraffe. Dinner and overnight at hotel/lodge.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park to Nairobi
day_4.description: Extensive early morning game drive in Lake Nakuru National Park. Then breakfast, we depart for Nairobi arriving in the afternoon. After lunch, you will de dropped at the airport/hotel.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 10-Day Mara Nakuru Amboseli Serengeti Ngorongoro Nairobi

overview.route_description: This is a safari tour that covers the 2 most famous East African countries with the best and largest national parks. The safari covers the best parks in Kenya Amboseli, Lake Nakuru and Masai Mara. In Tanzania, it covers Lake Manyara, Serengeti, Ngorongoro Crater and Tarangire National Park. The price provided is for a private safari but a group rate can be requested.

day_1.description: You'll be picked up from the hotel /airport very early in the morning and drive past Athi plains. On your way will see Maasai structure houses as you approach the Masai Mara. On arrival, have lunch and then proceed to a game viewing drive in search of the park residents. Later, return to the camp for dinner and your overnight stay.

day_2.description: Have an early morning breakfast at your lodge then drive to a full-day game drive with packed lunch. There is an option for morning and afternoon game drives depending on your choice. You'll have the chance of seeing the cats and the biggest mammals, wildebeests. Dinner and your overnight stay are at the camp.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve - Lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description: Leave in the morning and drive to Lake Nakuru arriving in time for lunch. Have lunch at the hotel and then proceed to an afternoon game drive in search of the wildlife. If you are lucky, you can see rhinos and many other animals. Dinner and your overnight stay are at the hotel.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park - Amboseli National Park
day_4.description: Leave Nakuru in the morning and drive to Amboseli. Arrive in time for lunch and have lunch at the camp. Then proceed for an afternoon game drive in search of wildlife. Amboseli offers the best view of the highest mountain in Africa. Dinner and your overnight stay at the camp.

day_5.destination: Amboseli National Park
day_5.description: Have a full day in Amboseli with morning and afternoon game-viewing drives. Or a full-day game drive in search of the park residents like lion, buffaloes, antelopes, warthogs, wildebeests, and elephants as well as the view of Africa's highest mountain if the weather permits. All meals and your overnight stay are at Kimana Tented Camp.

day_6.description: Have an early morning breakfast and depart for the Namanga border where you will exchange vehicles and proceed to Tanzania. Lunch can be en route or at the hotel in Arusha. Arrive in Arusha and check in at the hotel. In the afternoon, rest at the hotel. Dinner and your overnight stay are at the Ambassador Hotel.

name: 6-Day Masai Mara, Lake Nakuru, Amboseli NP Low-Cost Tour

overview.route_description: Experience the 6 Days/ 5 Nights Masai Mara NP, Lake Nakuru & Amboseli NP Low-Cost/Budget Tour. The 6 days Kenya budget trip covers the most pleasing Wildlife Parks in Kenya. You will be able to have Kilimanjaro-boasting Amboseli National Park at your feet – overflowing with elephants, the rhinos and flamingos of Lake Nakuru, the geological wonderment of the Great Rift Valley, the unfettered culture of the Masai Mara and its epic kaleidoscope of wildlife species.

day_1.destination: Nairobi - masai Mara game reserve tour
day_1.description:
Depart from Nairobi in the morning with pick up from your hotel/Airport and drive along the floor of the Rift Valley to Maasai Mara arriving at the camp in the afternoon for lunch.
Afternoon game drives followed by dinner and overnight stay at Mara osero camp or any of similar.

day_2.destination: Mara Big Cats, Predators, and Wildebeest Migration River crossing trails
day_2.description:
Full day spent exploring the park in search of the big 5. Morning and afternoon game drives are offered. An optional hot air balloon safari can be arranged at an extra cost of US$ 450 per person. Dinner and overnight stay at Osero Camp or any of similar
The Mara offers wildlife in such variety and abundance that it is difficult to believe: over 450 species of animals have been recorded here.
You will easily see lions, rhinos, hippos, crocodiles, giraffes, wildebeests, zebras, buffalo, warthogs, hyenas, jackals, wild dogs, buffalo, leopard, many kinds of antelopes, and elephant. It is in the Mara that perhaps the most spectacular event of the natural world takes place.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara - Lake Nakuru National park Adventure
day_3.description:
Early morning game drive till around 9:00 am breakfast then drive to Lake Nakuru National park enjoying once again the Great Rift Valley viewing sceneries en route, arriving at the Pink Lake often referred so due to its Great masses of Flamingos arriving in good time for lunch at golden palace resort afternoon game drives the scenic park famed for numerous species of birdlife especially the pink lesser flamingos.
Dinner and overnight stay at Lake Nakuru Lodge or Similar.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru – Amboseli National Park
day_4.description:
Depart the camp soon after breakfast and proceed to Lake Nakuru for a game drive. Lunch en route as you proceed to Amboseli National park.
If time permits, have an evening game drive as you proceed to your camp. Dinner and overnight at Amboseli AA Safari lodge experience or any similar.

day_5.destination: Amboseli National Park - Explore Photographers Paradise
day_5.description:
Full day in Amboseli with morning and afternoon game drive (optional visits to Masai village). All meals and overnight at AA lodge or any similar depending on your budget.

Amboseli National park is one of the most popular wildlife sanctuaries in Kenya. It is situated close to Kenya. It is situated close to Kenya- Tanzania border.
The Park lies at the foot of Mt. Kilimanjaro, the highes t mountain in Africa (5,896m) whose snow-capped summit presents a splendid view on clear days. Amboseli National Park is often referred to as “The home of Elephants’ some of the largest Elephant herds are found here.

day_6.destination: Depart Amboseli National Park and head back to Nairobi City
day_6.description: Depart for Nairobi City after an early morning game drive and then we drive back to the lodge for a sumptuous breakfast. Arrive in Nairobi City in time for Lunch. We then transfer you to the airport for your flight home.

name: 4-Day 3Nights Amazing Wild Safari Sentrim Mara Game Camp

overview.route_description: This amazing / exciting wild safari tour covers 4days, 3nights in Maasai Mara and includes guests/clients park entry fees, meals on full board(lunch, dinner and breakfast), 6game drives, transport by safari van with a pop up roof for game viewing/photography on private basis, and accommodation at Sentrim Mara Camp. The Camp has an en-suite swimming pool, private built-in toilets, hot showers, and an electric power supply from a generator. Come explore Africa ( Masai Mara Game Reserve ) with us!

day_3.description: Full day spent game viewing exploring the park in search of the Big 5. Early morning and late afternoon game drives are offered. day_4.destination: Masai Mara Game Reserve - Nairobi

The world-famous Masai mara with rolling grassland, acacia trees and immense herds of zebras and wildebeests mixed with the exciting and colourful masai culture.

name: 6-Day Amboseli, Lake Nakuru, Masai Mara Discover Kenya

overview.route_description: Our 6-day Amboseli, Lake Nakuru, Masai Mara safari starts with game viewing in Amboseli National Park, close to the Tanzanian border flanked by Mount Kilimanjaro. Amboseli is a compact game park, abundant in wildlife, which makes for some excellent game viewing. From Amboseli, we will head to the important wildlife sanctuary of Lake Nakuru National Park, via the Great Rift Valley. Then it's off to the famous Masai Mara National Reserve for game viewing in one of Africa's best game parks.

day_1.description: Depart Nairobi in the morning and drive to Amboseli National Park arriving at Amboseli Kibo Safari Camp well in time for lunch. Have an afternoon game drive in the park, a park famous for its big game and great scenic beauty whose entire landscape is dominated by Mount Kilimanjaro. Dinner and your overnight stay are at the Amboseli Kibo Safari Camp.

day_2.destination: Full Day in Amboseli National Park
day_2.description: Have an early morning pre-breakfast game drive at 6:30 am, when you'll have the best chance to see the majestic Mount Kilimanjaro. Return to the lodge for a late breakfast. The rest of the morning is spent at leisure. You'll then have an afternoon game drive. All meals and your overnight stay are at Kibo Safari Camp.

day_3.destination: Amboseli National Park - Nairobi - Lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description: Depart Amboseli in the morning and drive via Nairobi to the floor of the Rift Valley with hot or picnic lunch en route to Lake Nakuru National Park, arriving for your afternoon game drive. Besides the flamingos that the lake is famous for, there are approximately 400 other species of birds visiting the lake. Also, many species of game can be found in the park including the introduced Rothschild's giraffe, black and white rhino, waterbuck, reedbuck, lion, buffalo, leopard, baboon and many species of plains game. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Lake Nakuru Lodge.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park - Masai Mara National Reserve
day_4.description: Depart after breakfast and drive further along the floor of the Rift Valley to Masai Mara National Reserve arriving at Masai Mara Sopa Lodge, a mid-luxury lodge in time for lunch. In the afternoon, have a game drive that introduces you to this vast game-filled reserve. Dinner and your overnight stay are at the lodge.

day_5.destination: Full Day in Masai Mara National Reserve
day_5.description: Spend the full day in Maasai Mara, Kenya's most popular game sanctuary where you will have the best opportunity of spotting the Big Five (lion, leopard, buffalo, rhino and elephant). Enjoy morning and afternoon game drives with the option of visiting a local Maasai village. All meals and your overnight stay are at Masai Mara Sopa Lodge.

day_6.description: After breakfast, drive back to Nairobi arriving at approximately 2:00 pm. You'll be dropped off at your hotel or transferred to the airport for your onward flight home. End of services.

name: 5-Day Amboseli, Tsavo West, Tsavo East & Taita Saltlick

overview.route_description: While on this five day tour starting from Nairobi and Ending at the Kenyan Coast in Diani/ Mombasa or Malindi, you will visit Amboseli where you will stay for 1 Night at the Oltukai Lodge, Tsavo West for a night at the Kilaguni Serena Safari Lodge, Tsavo East while stying at the Ashnil Aruba Lodge and finish off a the Taita Saltlick game sancuary staying at the Taita Saltlick Lodge where you will spend one night. This tour can be customised.

day_1.description: Pick up from your Nairobi city hotel or residence at 7.00 a.m. and drive to Amboseli via the Athi Plains, home of the Masai. The drive time will be approximately 4.00 hours. Enter Amboseli Park driving slowly, looking for lions, elephants, cheetahs, leopards, gazelles, antelopes and different kind of birds. Check in at Amboseli Serena Safari Lodge, after checking in take your lunch followed by a short afternoon relaxation. At 4 pm go for the evening game drive in the small but game filled Amboseli national park with a chance to see Elephants, lions, cheetahs, gazelles, wildebeests, buffalos zebras, warthogs, different birds and of course Mount Kilimanjaro. Dinner and overnight at Amboseli Serena Safari Lodge. Meal Plan: {Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner}.

day_2.description: Have your morning breakfast at 6.30 a.m. then depart for a two-hour game drive until 9.00 a.m when you join the convoy to Tsavo West. The drive to Tsavo West is approximately 1 Hour. Have a game drive via the scenic shetani lava flow- a formation left after the explosion of Mt. Kilimanjaro several million years back. This extended game drive will take you until lunch hour. Lunch will be at the Kilaguni Serena Safari. After lunch, have an afternoon game drive en route to the rhino Sanctuary This sanctuary is home to the rare and endangered black rhino plus the “big five of Africa” The lion, leopard, elephant, buffalo and the Rhino. At 6.00 p.m., return to the Kilaguni Serena Safari Lodge for dinner and overnight. Meal Plan: {Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner}.

day_3.description: Have your breakfast at 6.30 a.m followed by a game drive via the Mzima Springs where crystal clear water emanates from the underground. Springs originating from the Mt. Kilimanjaro. Hippos crocodile, fish and variety of bird life exists. Later depart for the neighboring Tsavo East National with a mid morning game drive en route to the Ashnil Aruba Lodge for Lunch. After lunch, relax at the camp as you await your evening game drive that will be at 4.00 to 6.00 p.m. Dinner and overnight at the Ashnil Aruba Lodge. Meal Plan: {Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner}.

day_4.destination: Tsavo East to Taita Saltlick Game Sanctuary
day_4.description: Wake up at around 5.45 am, have a cup of coffee and start an early morning game drive before the main breakfast. This time you have a chance of seeing the big cats of Tsavo. Back to the lodge for the main breakfast at around 8.30 am followed by the last game drive and depart to Taita Hills salt lick driving through a distance of 80 kms. Arrive early afternoon, check in at Taita Hills Lodge where you will have your lunch. Depart at around 2.30 pm to the Saltlick Lodge where you will have a chance to see animals at the water hole, while at Salt Lick Lodge. Proceed for another game drive at 4.00 pm until 6.30 pm. Taita Hills wild life sanctuary was founded by the Hilton early seventies. It covers an area of 24,000 Ha. Physical attractions include thorny bushes, acacia forests, arid and savannah, swamp and Taita hills among others. Animals found here include elephants, lions, cheetah, zebras, giraffes, and many different types of birds. Dinner and overnight at Salt lick lodge.

day_5.destination: Taita Saltlick Wildlife Sanctuary to Mombasa/Diani Beach
day_5.description:
Early morning game drive at 6.30am until 8.30am time for your breakfast. After breakfast, game viewing en route as you leave Tsavo East National park exiting through the Voi gate to the Voi SGR trai terminus for your 12.00 p.m. train to Mombasa arriving at 2.00 p.m. You will be picked from the train station and transfer to your Coastal hotel with a brief stop for lunch in Mombasa town. Drop off at your Hotel. Meal Plan: {Breakfast and Lunch}.

Train tickets and transfers included in the tour cost.

day_6.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 4-Day Lake Naivasha and Masai Mara Safari (Mid-Range)

overview.route_description: If you are looking for the perfect retreat without breaking the bank, the above Lake Naivasha and Masai Mara safari is ideal. You'll wine and dine in fine mid-range hotels, sample the scenic beauty of Hell's Gate National Park, and embark on epic game drives inside the Masai Mara on your last leg. The Mara reserve is home to the magical Wildebeest Migration, often described as the world's eighth wonder. We assure you of memories to last a lifetime; welcome aboard and enjoy the safari.

day_1.description:
This tour starts in Nairobi just after breakfast. Your driver-guide will pick you up from your hotel, then depart towards Lake Naivasha. En route, you'll make a stop over at the  Mau Escarpment viewpoint, from where you'll be treated to sweeping views of the floor of the Rift Valley below, L. Naivasha, and Mt. Longonot. This outpost is excellent for photo ops! You'll then continue your descent into Lake Naivasha, arriving around noon with ample time for check-in, and lunch.
Later in the afternoon, you'll embark on a boat ride on Lake Naivasha to see the abundant freshwater, and marine life, including tens of bird species, hippos, and the occasional grazers near the shorelines. Your boat tour guide will explain the lake's economic importance to the local community, besides its critical role in biodiversity.

Ahoy! In the early evening, you'll return to shore, where your driver guide will drop you off for an evening of relaxation, followed by dinner and an overnight stay at the lodge.

day_2.destination: Depart Lake Naivasha for Masai Mara NR
day_2.description:
On this day, you will have an early breakfast followed by an early check-out.

You'll visit Hell's Gate National Park for a scenic drive. While the park has a low population of scattered wildlife-mainly herbivores, it makes up for that with picturesque scenery and rock formations, including the towering cliffs, water-gouged gorges, stark rock towers, scrub-clad volcanoes, and belching plumes of geothermal steam."Hell's Gate" annotates to the intense geothermal activity within its boundaries, and even features a naturally heated geothermal spa.
Later, you'll drive toward Masai Mara, arriving at Osero Lodge in time for check-in and lunch. In the afternoon, just as the heat dissipates, we'll head out for a game drive until evening. Our seasoned drivers/guides will ensure you make the most of it- and chances are over 80% that you'll spot the Big Five. Just before sunset, return to a laid-back atmosphere at Osero Lodge
Dinner and overnight stay at Osero Lodge.

day_3.destination: Full Game Package in the Masai Mara
day_3.description:
You'll wake up to an early breakfast and an early departure into the Masai Mara Reserve. Carry along your camera, and we'll also have a pair of binoculars on board to help with distant sightings. As you'll be on safari most of the day, the lodge will pack a picnic lunch to ensure an uninterrupted game drive. If you wish to return a bit earlier, you can return to the lodge around 4pm to cool off at the pool set into the bamboo woods surrounding Osero Lodge. You can have some relaxation time till dinner time. After dinner, you can relax, have a drink (not included in the safari cost) at the bar, and perhaps even catch up with other travelers.
Later, dinner and overnight stay at Osero.

day_4.destination: Masai Mara -Nairobi
day_4.description:
7:00-7:45 am- Breakfast, then check-out

8:45 -10:00 am Masai Village Visit just as you exit Masai Mara National Reserve. A cultural visit gives you an insight into the Masai people's way of life. This nomadic community has co-existed with the Masai Mara wildlife since first settling in the Transmara region.

Later, Transfer by road from Masai Mara to Nairobi, with a drop-off at the hotel or airport around the afternoon. We'll make a stopover for lunch or refreshments on the way (cost of last day lunch not included in this package)

End of safari.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 3-Day Amazing Mid-Range Amboseli Safari

overview.route_description: In Amboseli National Park, elephants roam against a backdrop of Mount Kilimanjaro. Located in southern Kenya, you can take your Kenyan safari through one of the most diverse ecosystems on the planet. Your expert Kenyan safari guides will be able to track the wildlife and give you the best chance to see the fauna that make this place so special. The long dry season in Amboseli means your chances of spotting stunning animals in their natural habitat on your African safari are high.

day_1.destination: Nairobi – Amboseli National Park (250 km – 4 to 5 hours)
day_1.description:
Pick up from Nairobi is at 7.30 am, where we’ll take you on a drive through typical African savanna. You’ll pass local homesteads and catch glimpses of Masai herdsmen grazing their cattle. You’ll arrive at Amboseli National Park in time for lunch.

After you’ve had time to rest, we’ll take you into the park for your first African safari experience. On your game viewing drive, we’ll be on the look out for the stars of the Amboseli – elephants, lions, giraffes, cheetahs, zebras, wildebeest, and a whole load more.

The backdrop to your Kenyan adventure is Mount Kilimanjaro, its snow-capped peak dominates the skyline as Africa’s highest mountain. Marvel at the natural beauty of the awe-inspiring plains, home to a massively diverse ecosystem of animals.

Following your first adventure into the Kenyan wilds, you’ll head back to your camp for dinner and a good night’s rest.

day_2.destination: Full Day in Amboseli National Park
day_2.description:
The second day on safari in Kenya starts with an extensive game drive. The vista of Kilimanjaro will be with you as your range through Amboseli, expertly guided by our African safari guides.

As on your first day, the mega fauna of the national park will be on display. With luck you’ll see herds of buffalo, families of elephants, prides of lions, and much more besides.

You can choose to take an optional extra visit to a Masai village. These warriors are part of a proud nomadic tradition that you are invited to learn about in their village. The tribes people of the Masai are renowned for their prowess in battle against wild animals; their strength and courage admired around the world.

Your visit will show you the Masai culture, with a welcoming presentation of traditional signing and dancing; part of their sacred rituals. This memorable experience will let you see their daily lives and homes and will captivate you every second of your visit.

day_3.description:
An early start will show you the sunrise with a game drive into the Amboseli, experiencing the dawn chorus and transition from night to morning across the savanna. You’ll then return to your lodge for breakfast.

Following breakfast, it’s time to check out of your accommodation and bid farewell to Amboseli National Park. You’ll be transported back to Nairobi with an early afternoon arrival and the option of a hotel, residence, or airport drop-off depending on your requirements.

No accommodation included
Breakfast and lunch, but no dinner
Drinking water, other drinks are extra.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 7-Day Magical Kenyan Safari Experience

overview.route_description: This tour takes you to various national parks, including Tsavo East and Tsavo West. You will take in breathtaking views of the Chyulu hills, the Shetani lava flow, Mzima Springs, and Mount Kilimanjaro. Magical Amboseli, Lake Naivasha, and the Masai Mara complete this amazing safari experience. This tour can start in either Nairobi or Mombasa.

day_1.description: You will be picked up from the hotel and participate in a short briefing before starting your safari in Tsavo East National Park. You will enter through the Bachuma Gate and begin your game drive in the park as you make your way to the lodge for check-in and lunch. You will go on an afternoon game drive in the park until the late evening before returning to the lodge for dinner and your overnight stay.

day_2.destination: Tsavo East - Tsavo West National Park
day_2.description: After an early morning game drive, you will drive back to the lodge for a full breakfast. Later you will depart Tsavo East and enjoy a short game drive en route to Tsavo West, where you will arrive in time for check-in and lunch. Enjoy an afternoon game drive before driving back to the lodge for dinner and your overnight stay.

day_3.description: After breakfast you will leave the park and pay a visit to the Shetani lava flow and Mzima Springs. You will then make your way to Amboseli National Park and arrive at the lodge in time for check-in and lunch. An afternoon game drive in the park will offer you great views of Mount Kilimanjaro. You also have the option to visit a Masai Village (cost not included). Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the Amboseli Serena Lodge.

day_4.destination: Amboseli - Lake Naivasha
day_4.description: After breakfast you will check out and enjoy a game drive en route to Lake Naivasha. After lunch you will spend some time relaxing before enjoying an afternoon game drive to Crescent Island (cost not included). Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the lodge.

day_5.destination: Lake Naivasha - Masai Mara National Reserve
day_5.description: After breakfast you will depart Lake Naivasha and drive to Masai Mara National Reserve. You will enjoy a short game drive before arriving at the lodge in time for check-in and lunch. After eating you will embark on an afternoon game drive. Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the lodge.

day_6.description: After breakfast you will depart with a lunch box in hand and spend the whole day on a game drive in the park. You will eat a picnic lunch in the bush before embarking on an afternoon game drive. If you are tired you have the option to return to the lodge or visit a Masai village (cost not included).

name: 10-Day From Kenya to Tanzania - High-End

overview.route_description: Spend five days in Kenya (Lake Nakuru and Masai Mara) and 5 days in Tanzania (Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro and Manyara). This tour transfers from Masai Mara to Serengeti through Isebania Border. If you'd like, at the end of the tour, instead of finishing in Arusha, you can transfer to Amboseli for 1 or 2 nights in this national park and finish the tour back in Nairobi. This tour can also be done in the opposite order (starting in Arusha).

day_1.description:
You'll have an early morning pick up then drive to Lake Nakuru National Park. Across the equator, southwards of Bogoria, lies the Rift Valley's most famous Lake Nakuru. Known all over the world for its flamingoes, it's alkaline and is recognized as being one of the natural wonders of the world. Lake Nakuru is now a rhino sanctuary, harboring a population of over 40 black and more than 60 white rhinos, but the flamingos, of course, have always been the main attraction. At times there may be almost 2 million flamingos in the residence, forming a stunningly beautiful deep pink band around the edge of the lakeshore. Arrive in time for lunch then have an afternoon game drive.
Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the campsite or lodge.

day_2.description:
You'll have an early morning drive to Masai Mara National Reserve. It holds on as one of the few places left on earth where wildlife still lives comparatively undisturbed, in the numbers that once roamed the plains and forests of Africa. As the northern tip of the vast Serengeti ecosystem, the Mara hosts the spectacular seasonal migration of many thousands of wildebeest, zebras and attendant predators. You'll arrive in time for lunch followed by an afternoon game drive.
Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the campsite or lodge.

day_3.description:
You'll have two full days in the Masai Mara with a flexible schedule and unlimited mileage. After breakfast, we will have a full-day game drive with packed lunch provided. The reserve is well known for its black-manned lion as well as its abundant resident wildlife and it's one of the few places where it's possible to see the Big Five during a morning's game drive. Many of the cheetahs are so tame they seek shelter from the hot sun under one's vehicle and several even climb onto the
roof to get a better view of prospective prey.
For the bird enthusiast, almost 500 species have been recorded: among these 16 species of eagle, plus many hawks and falcons, 6 species of vultures, 8 species of storks, 4 species of bustard (including the Kori bustard, the world's heaviest flying bird), and 9 species of sunbirds.
Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the campsite or lodge.

day_4.destination: Serengeti National Park
day_4.description: We will initiate the day with an early morning game drive in Masai Mara while driving out of the national reserve. After border formalities, drive to the Serengeti National Park in Tanzania. It will be a long day of driving but the game drives in and out of the parks can be surprisingly incredible. However, we always recommend flying from one park to the other so that you can have more time to go on safari. Alternatively, you can add an extra day to visit Lake Victoria, halfway between the two parks. Dinner and your overnight will be at the campsite or lodge.

day_5.destination: Serengeti National Park
day_5.description:
Enjoy two full days in the Serengeti with flexible schedule and unlimited mileage. As you crest the hillside, spread out before you, as far as the eyes can see, is the vast Serengeti. Serengeti mean "endless plains" in Kiswahili and this 6,900 sq mile (18,000 sq km) park. It is inhabited by more than 2 million large animals including more than a million wildebeest, hundreds of thousands of plains zebras, and Thomson's gazelles. Large predators including lions, cheetahs, and hyenas are drawn to the area by this abundance of prey that migrates throughout the park. Many smaller animals like rock hyrax, bat eared foxes, mongoose, honey badger, jackals, monkeys, baboons and African hares also inhabit the area along with nearly
500 species of birds.

day_6.description:
Today you will wake up very early to do an early morning safari before breakfast, to spot the animals when they are more active. Also, you'll have a fantastic sunrise in front of you. The sunrise in the African Savannah is one of the most beautiful experiences one can have. After the game drive, return to the camp for brunch. In the afternoon, transfer to Ngorongoro, the 8th Natural Wonder of the World. With walls, 2,000 ft high and a crater floor that spreads for 102 sq miles, the crater is a virtual Noah's Ark, inhabited by almost every species of wildlife indigenous to East Africa including the rare black rhino.
The large bull elephants that reside here have extremely large tusks, due to the rich mineral content of the volcanic soil and its grasses. They are the most incredible elephants you'll ever see in your life.

name: 9-Day Explore Kenya & Tanzania Wildlife Group Tour

overview.route_description: Take this adventure which will visit Masai Mara, Nairobi, Ngorongoro Crater, Serengeti National Park, and Arusha town. There, you will be able to see the Big Five. Take part in a half-day game drive in Ngorongoro Crater and exploration of the wildlife as well as the landscape in Serengeti. Enjoy the vast plains of Masai mara.
