day_1.destination: Nairobi to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_1.description: Have breakfast at the hotel and later depart to Maasai Mara National Reserve. Upon arrival in the park, you will have an en-route game drive heading to the lodge, for check in and lunch. Then you will have an evening game drive. Later, return to the lodge for dinner and your overnight stay. An exploratory drive around the 1,792sq km game park with its low hills and savannah-type rolling grasslands, gallery forest on the Mara River and its tributaries. Get introduced to the herbivores; elephants, rhinos, buffalo, the variety of antelopes, the Masai giraffes and the Burchell zebras. The carnivores are the black-maned lion, cheetah and leopard. Also to be seen are the largest birds, the Masai ostrich, the secretary bird, the crested crane and saddle-billed stork. Crocodiles and hippos share the river. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Miti Mingi Eco Camp.

day_2.destination: Full-Day in Masai Mara National Reserve
day_2.description: You can take the optional early morning balloon safari ride (US$450.00 per person ), across the Maasai Mara plains. Have breakfast at the lodge then enjoy morning and afternoon game drives. Masai Mara is an extension of the Serengeti ecosystem to the south. Game abounds here. The Mara is noted for its abundance of lions particularly the superb black-maned males. It is where the great migration of over 1.5 million wildebeest and other antelopes cross the mighty Mara River. You are also likely to see lots of elephants here often in large herds and if you're lucky, leopard, cheetah and rhino. All of the Big Five are residents. You're sure to see the African buffalo. Get the cameras ready, stock up on film/tapes, and enjoy yourselves! In the evening, visit the Maasai village. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Miti Mingi Eco Camp.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve to Nairobi
day_3.description: Enjoy in the morning, have a game drive in Masai Mara and try spotting the animals you didn't see the previous day. Enjoy the breeze and later depart to Nairobi. You will have your lunch en-route. Depending on your arrival time, have a city tour. Dinner and your overnight stay are at After 40 Hotel.

day_4.destination: Nairobi to Arusha Town
day_4.description: Enjoy your morning breakfast. Then depart to Arusha from Nairobi through the Namaga border using a shuttle bus. Upon arrival at the border, clear with immigration then proceed with your journey to Arusha town. You will be transferred to your hotel. Your lunch and overnight stay are at Arusha Tourist Inn Hotel.

day_5.destination: Arusha to Lake Manyara National Park
day_5.description:
At 8:30 am, drive from Arusha to Lake Manyara National Park for game drives with picnic lunch boxes. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Panorama Campsite.
Lake Manyara National Park is a small but scenic safari park, excellent for bird watching and a good area to find elephants as well as the potential excitement of spotting the legendary Lake Manyara tree-climbing lions. Lake Manyara is a good soft introduction to the safari experience in Tanzania. It is a magical and pretty park that winds its way around a mainly forested driving route between the banks of the soda water lake and the impressive rise of the Great Rift escarpment.
Elephants, giraffes, buffalo, and wildebeest can be found grazing in unexpected clearings or heading towards the water to drink or wash. The rivers and riverbeds provide scenic vistas for possible animal spotting.

day_6.destination: Lake Manyara National Park to Serengeti National Park
day_6.description:
After breakfast, depart for Serengeti National Park with picnic lunch boxes and game drives en-route to Serengeti. Dinner and your overnight stay are at Seronera Campsite.
This land is justifiably famous for its huge concentrations of wildlife, especially the big cats, as well as for being the stomping ground of the Great Migration. This is a massive accumulation of 1.5 million wildebeest, 200,000 zebras and 350,000 gazelles stretching their legs over 1,200 miles in an annual race to find enough water and green grass for their survival. The park is broadly divided into three distinct areas, the Seronera Valley and Seronera River, the Western Corridor and the Northern Lobo area that extends northwards through the Lamai Wedge to the Masai Mara.

name: ½-Day Nairobi National Park Tour in Kenya

day_1.description:
You will be picked from your hotel or airport for an early morning or afternoon game drive. The game drive will take about 4 hours in the Nairobi National Park. The tour will start with a visit to the ivory burning site where elephant tusks and rhino horns have been torched by Kenyan presidents to show the country’s commitment to stop poaching. You will also be driven around in search of the parks diverse wildlife. In the course of the game drive, you will visit one of the several picnic sites to have a short break.

In case you have more time and at extra cost, there is an optional visit to the Nairobi Animal Orphanage which is located in the Nairobi National Park. It serves as treatments and rehabilitation center for wild animals. The Nairobi animal orphanage hosts lions, cheetahs, hyenas, jackals, serval cats, rare Sokoke cats, warthogs among many other wildlife.

After the tour, you will be taken back to the airport or your hotel.

This National Park is also home to lion, perilous rhinos and you can possibly be able to spot some photographic view of leopard in the Acacia tree.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Masai Mara Game Reserve
day_1.description: Pick up from the airport or  from your hotel and depart for the journey south along the floor of the Great Rift Valley. Lunch served en-route, then past Narok climb the western wall entering Hemingway's country "Serengeti plains". Arrive late afternoon in the Masai Mara Game Reserve. Afternoon Game drive. Dinner and overnight at the lodge.

day_2.description: After breakfast with picnic lunch, you spend full day game viewing with a visit to the Mara river where there is concentration of a lot of animals. You will have your picnic lunch as you watch the crocodiles, hippos and other animals living in water. This day you have the option of going to visit the Masai villages. All meals and overnight at the lodge.

day_3.description: After breakfast with picnic lunch, you spend full day game viewing with a visit to the Mara river where there is concentration of a lot of animals. You will have your picnic lunch as you watch the crocodiles, hippos and other animals living in water. This day you have the option of going to visit the Masai villages. day_4.destination: Masai Mara to Lake Nakuru National Park
day_4.description: After breakfast leave the Lodge and depart for Nakuru. Lunch is served en-route. L. Nakuru is renowned for it's large variety of world famous birds. Its possible to see other game such as Rhino, Waterbucks, Impala, Buffalo and Gazelle in the surrounding gardens. Dinner and overnight at  Lake Nakuru Lodge.

day_5.destination: Lake Nakuru to Lake Bogoria
day_5.description: Morning spent game viewing at Lake Nakuru and in the afternoon proceed to lake Baringo. Those who prefer can organise a boat trip to view the many birds which inhabit this lake at extra cost. Dinner and overnight at Lake Bogoria Lodge, Lake Baringo Country Club.

day_6.description: Explore on foot this nature lake and view the flamingos in their thousands. Caution must be taken while walking near the hot springs as these are super hot. Depart for Nairobi in the afternoon via Nakuru. On arrival Nairobi you will be taken to your hotel or dropped at the airport.

name: 4-Day Expedition to Masai Mara and Lake Nakuru

overview.route_description: A stunning motley of wild and rugged landscapes, warm and welcoming people, and an exciting array of creatures both big and small, awaits you on the 4 days trip. Expect an amazing wildebeest migration in the months of July to November every single year.

day_1.destination: Pickup from Hotel Then Proceed to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_1.description: You will depart from Nairobi in the morning and drive to the floor of the Great Rift Valley headed to Masai Mara National Reserve. You will arrive at the reserve’s tented camp in time for lunch and then head out for an afternoon game drive. You will return later in the day at 6:30 p.m. for dinner and your overnight stay at Aa Lodge Mara which is close to the Sekenani Camp Gate.

day_2.description: After breakfast, you will take off for a morning game drive that will take you on a search for the great predators and perhaps even cubs. On the plains, you will see enormous herds of grazing animals as well as the chance to spy on the elusive cheetah and leopard hiding amidst the acacia boughs. You will have a full-day game drive along the famous Mara River. The river is the gateway to the annual migration of wildebeest from Serengeti to Masai Mara. This great spectacular features the pounding of over 6 million hooves from the vast Serengeti plains to the champagne-colored hills of Kenya’s Masai Mara. Here you'll find wildebeests, gazelles and some zebras relentlessly tracked by Africa’s greatest predators, migrate in a clockwise fashion approximately 2,800 kilometers, each year.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve - Lake Nakuru National Park
day_3.description: After breakfast, you will depart Masai Mara and head to Lake Nakuru National Park. Arrive in time for lunch at the Sarova Lion Hill Game Lodge, followed by a late afternoon game drive. Lake Nakuru is known all over the world for its pink flamingos. Besides the flamingos, there are roughly 390 other species of birds visiting the lake as well as many species of wildlife e.g rhinoceros, lions, Rothchild giraffes (found only in Nakuru and Baringo). At the end of the day, you will return to the Sarova Lion Hill Game Lodge for dinner and your overnight stay.

day_4.destination: Drive Back to Nairobi
day_4.description: After breakfast, you will head out for your en-route game drive as you leave Lake Nakuru National Park on your way back to Nairobi. You will be dropped off at the airport to catch your flight or the booked hotel. This is where your safari will end.

day_5.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

overview.route_description: Best of Kenya wildlife lodge safari sampling the most famous game parks and scenery. A combination of wildlife, bird watching and scenery of Kenya the land of beauty. A safari to the foothill of Mt. Kilimanjaro Amboseli, Mount Kenya National Park, en route to Samburu National Reserve home for the special five. Drive on the floor of the Rift Valley, lie the beautiful Lake Nakuru National Park. drive west past Mt. Longonot and to the world-renowned Masai Mara.

day_1.description: Upon arrival at the Jomo Kenyatta Airport, you will be met by our airport representative and transferred to your city hotel for overnight. Our rep will take you through a brief pre-safari orientation before embarking on your dream safari adventure of Kenya. Dinner on own arrangement. Overnight in Nairobi Ibis Hotel.

day_2.description:
Breakfast and drive to Amboseli. After crossing the frontier town of Namanga, on the border with Tanzania, the semidesertic landscape brings us to the Amboseli National Park to arrive in time for lunch. Afternoon game drive includes searching for the Big Five, elephants, Buffalos, lions, Rhinos and leopards and the great view of Mount Kilimanjaro before returning to your lodge as the sun sets! Dinner and overnight - Amboseli Sopa Lodge.
Distance Approx. 250 kms - 4 hrs drive
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_3.description:
Breakfast and drive to Aberdares with lunch in Nairobi. Proceed on driving through Kikuyu land and onward through the lush tea and coffee plantations to the Mount Kenya National Park. You will arrive at Mount Kenya Safari Club in the late afternoon. Dinner and overnight at Mont Kenya Safari Club. Distance: Approx. 450 kms – 6 hrs drive
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_4.destination: Mount Kenya - Samburu Game Reserve
day_4.description:
Breakfast and commence drive nd crossing the equator at Nanyuki, en route to Samburu National Reserve. Lunch at the respective Lodge. Late afternoon game viewing drive. Dinner and overnight at Samburu Sopa Lodge or similar. Distance: Approx. 200 kms – 4 hrs drive
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_5.destination: Samburu - Lake Nakuru National Park
day_5.description:
Breakfast and depart for Lake Nakuru national park to arrive for lunch. The afternoon game drive is included and you will return to your lodge as the sun sets! Dinner and overnight – Lake Nakuru Flamingo Resort & Spa or similar
Distance: Approx. 200 kms - 3 hrs drive
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}

Lake Nakuru is a shallow soda lake, renowned for its huge concentration of flamingos. It is also a Rhino sanctuary. You embark on a game drive which includes a walk on the shores of the lake to view flamingoes from close range. Keep your eyes open for the elusive Leopard or the Tree climbing lions of this park.

day_6.destination: Lake Nakuru - Maasai Mara Game Reserve
day_6.description:
After breakfast climb the Western Escarpment of the Rift Valley and head towards Maasai Mara. With its vast open plains and distinctive flat-topped acacia trees, no visit to Kenya would be complete without a visit here. Enjoying views of the picturesque Maasai tribesmen herding cattle on the way, you arrive in time for lunch and a well deserved rest! Afternoon game drive includes searching for the Big Five, elephants, Buffalos, lions, Rhinos and leopards, before returning to your lodge as the sun sets! Dinner and overnight at Enkorok Mara Camp or similar.
Distance Approx. 310 kms – 6 hrs drive
Meal plan: {Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner}.

day_1.destination: Nairobi – Masai Mara National Reserve (265 km, 5 to 6 hours)
day_1.description:
Pick up from your Nairobi accommodation or Airport is at 7.30 am, and you’ll be taken on a journey through the Great African Rift Valley. You will be stunned and inspired by rolling plains and summits such as Mount Longonot and the Suswa Ranges.

Entering the Masai Mara, you are on the lands of the iconic Masai people, whose villages you’re your journey to your accommodation. After some time to settle into your rooms, your first game drive begins. Be on the look out for the wildlife you’ve been waiting for: giraffes, lions, rhinos, and so many more creatures of the grasslands will be roaming across the landscape.

The evening sees dinner served in your accommodation, when you can prepare for the big day of exploration in the morning. This first day of your Kenyan safari includes:

Accommodation at your lodge
Overnight stay inside Masai Mara Game Reserve
Lunch and dinner, no breakfast
Drinking water, other drinks are extra.

day_2.destination: Full Day in Masai Mara National Reserve
day_2.description:
The Masai Mara is home to millions of animals, teeming with biodiversity, and filled with eco-systems beyond imagining. Your full day inside Masai Mara will explore the wonders of the plains and show you the stunning animals within.
Acacia trees, animals, and birds are everywhere. Your skilled African safari guide will track and identify Serengeti animals.

This day will present you with a chance given to few – the option of a hot-air balloon safari. Change your perspective of the savanna and trace the movements of the fauna from the air, catching their shadows and contemplating their routes from above.

Visit a Masai community to learn about the nomadic warriors of the Great African Rift Valley. After a welcoming song and dance, visitors explore the hamlet, learn about Masai culture, and visit a family home. The balloon safari costs $490 and the village visit $30.

day_3.destination: Masai Mara National Reserve to Lake Nakuru National Park (300 km – 5 to 6 hours)
day_3.description:
You can choose an early morning game drive to watch as the plains transition from dawn to daylight – a time of great activity for the animals of the savanna. After breakfast you’ll progress through the Great African Rift Valley, with stops at scenic points giving you chance to capture photos of the enchanting scenery.

Arrive at Lake Nakuru National Park in time for lunch and then partake in an afternoon of bird watching. As well as flocks of bright pink flamingos, there are myriad bird species for you to marvel at. There’s also a rhino sanctuary within the park and you can choose to visit to see these most endangered of animals.

day_4.destination: Lake Nakuru National Park – Lake Naivasha (85, 2 hours)
day_4.description:
A morning of bird watching starts your day, before you continue your adventure through the valleys of Kenya and head to Lake Naivasha.

Once at the lake and having had lunch, there’ll be a boat trip to Crescent Island. Here, the large herbivores of the plains graze and cool down, with

Zebras
Hippos
Impalas
Buffalo
And plenty more animals ready to be spotted.

Other activities you can partake in at Lake Naivasha include optional extra such as bicycle riding and a tour of Hell’s Gate National Park.

We shall offer a 1 hour boat ride in Lake Naivasha at no extra fees.

You can change accommodation to luxury tented camps or lodges.

day_5.destination: Lake Naivasha – Amboseli National Park (310 km, 5 to 6 hours)
day_5.description:
Breakfast will ready for you the long yet easy drive to Amboseli. All around you will be the landscape of the Great African Rift Valley as you cruise down the Naivashi – Nairobi Highway. This is your chance to see a slice of rural Kenya – to see how the locals live away from the national parks.

Mount Kilimanjaro will come into view as you enter Amboseli National Park. Once your luggage is safely at your accommodation there’ll be an afternoon game drive, showcasing the rolling hills and great game of this part of the Serengeti.

This day on your wildlife safari includes

Accommodation at your tented camp.
Overnight stay inside Amboseli National Park
Breakfast, lunch, and dinner
Drinking water, other drinks are extra.

day_6.destination: Full Day in Amboseli National Park
day_6.description:
You’ll rise early for a pre-breakfast game drive. Life pervades every nook and valley of the grasslands at this time of day – nocturnal animals head to their resting places as the animals of the day begin their cycle of feeding and preying that breathes energy into the landscape.

Kilimanjaro, Africa’s highest mountain, watches over you roaming and with luck the clouds won’t roll in before you get your perfect photograph of the snow-capped peak. Spend your day looking out for

Elephants
Giraffes
Rhinos
Zebras
Wildebeest
And all the other fauna that live off the luscious, green grasslands of Kenya.

Lunch is served picnic style, surrounded by the beauty of the park and dinner is served at your accommodation. Included in the sixth day of your Kenyan safari is:

Accommodation at your tented camp.
Overnight stay inside Amboseli National Park
Breakfast, lunch, and dinner
Drinking water, other drinks are extra.

day_1.description:
You'll have an early morning drive to Masai Mara National Reserve.
It holds on as one of the few places left on earth where wildlife still lives comparatively undisturbed, in the numbers that once roamed the plains and forests of Africa. As the northern tip of the vast Serengeti ecosystem, the Mara hosts the spectacular seasonal migration of many thousands of wildebeest, zebras and attendant predators. You'll arrive in time for lunch followed by an afternoon game drive.
Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the campsite or lodge.

day_2.description:
After breakfast, we will have a full day game drive with packed lunch provided. The reserve is well known for its black-manned lion as well as abundant resident wildlife. It is one of the few places where it's possible to see the Big Five during a morning's game drive. Many of the cheetahs are so tame that they seek shelter from the hot sun under one's vehicle and several even climb onto the roof to get a better view of prospective prey.
For the bird enthusiast, almost 500 species have been recorded: among these 16 species of eagle, many hawks and falcons, 6 species of vultures, 8 species of storks, 4 of bustard (including the kori bustard, the world's heaviest flying bird), and 9 species of sunbirds.

Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the campsite or lodge.

day_3.destination: From Masai Mara National Resrve to Serengeti National Park
day_3.description:
You'll have a morning game drive in Masai Mara. We will initiate the day with an early morning game drive in Masai Mara while driving out of the national reserve. After border formalities, drive to the Serengeti National Park in Tanzania. On the way, you have an option to stop at the famous Olduvai Gorge, where Dr Louis and Mary Leakey made their discovery of the first man that walked the earth. After attending a short lecture describing the archaeological digs and geology of the gorge, you’ll have time to visit the small museum.
It will be a long day of driving but the game drives in and out of the parks can be surprisingly incredible.

Dinner and your overnight stay will be at the campsite or lodge.

day_4.destination: Serengeti National Park
day_4.description:
You'll have two full days in the Serengeti with a flexible schedule and unlimited mileage.
As you crest the hillside spread out before you, as far as the eyes can see, is the vast Serengeti. Serengeti means "endless plains" in Kiswahili. This 6,900sq mile (18,000sq km) park is inhabited by more than 2 million large animals including more than a million wildebeest, hundreds of thousands of plains zebras, and Thomson's gazelles. Large predators including lions, cheetahs, and hyenas are drawn to the area by this abundance of prey which migrates throughout the park. Many smaller animals like rock hyraxes, bat-eared foxes, mongoose, honey badgers, jackals, monkeys, baboons and African hares also inhabit the area along with nearly 500 species of birds.
In the afternoon, have a game drive en-route to the campsite.
Dinner and your overnight stay will be at a public campsite or private tented camp/lodge.

day_5.destination: Serengeti National Park to Ngorongoro Crater
day_5.description:
On this day we suggest a very early wake up in order to do an early morning game drive (when the animals are more active) and see one of the best sunrises you'll ever witness. After the game drive, we will return to the camp for a rewarding brunch and then we'll proceed to Ngorongoro, the 8th Wonder of the Natural World. The crater spreads for 102sq miles and has 2,000 ft high walls, making it virtually Noah's ark and inhabiting almost every species of wildlife that is indigenous to East Africa. It's one of the very rare locations in the whole continent where you can witness the black rhino. The crater has a river, several swamps, a soda lake with a great concentration of flamingos, a forest and open plains. It's also famous for its elephants which are the largest in the world and have huge tusks. Ngorongoro Crater is truly a Wonder of the Natural World.

You will reach Ngorongoro in time for a sundowner. There is a possibility to upgrade your accommodation level.

day_6.description: We will start the day very early and descend into the crater floor for an incredible morning of wildlife in one of the most stunning places on earth. After the game drive, there will be time for a picnic lunch near the beautiful hippo lake. After lunch, we will have time for a short game drive and then ascend the crater and exit Ngorongoro Conservation Area towards Arusha. We expect to be back in Arusha around 5:00 pm although we are flexible in case there is a flight to catch or another situation.

name: 1-Day Amboseli National Park Tour

overview.route_description: Crowned by Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak, the Amboseli National Park is one of Kenya's most popular parks. The name "Amboseli" comes from a Maasai word meaning "salty dust", and it is one of the best places in Africa to view large herds of elephants up close. Nature lovers can explore five different habitats here ranging from the dried-up bed of Lake Amboseli, wetlands with sulphur springs, the savannah and woodlands.

It is here that you can experience African hospitality up close and at its best.

day_1.description: After a hearty breakfast, your driver-guide reports to your hotel for start of the safari, with a departure for a picturesque drive descending the Great Rift Valley and onwards to Masai Mara, Kenya's famous game reserve. Stop briefly en route at the Great Rift Valley view point to enjoy the stunning views of an enormous valley system said to be visible from the outer space. Arrive in Maasai Mara in time for lunch. After lunch you will have an afternoon game drive which will allow spotting of the magnificent wildlife in the park. The reserve is known for providing excellent predator sightings thanks to its relatively large population of lion, cheetah and leopard. Bordering Tanzania, the Mara is in the northern extension of Serengeti and forms a wildlife corridor between the two countries. You'll return to the camp for dinner and overnight stay.

day_2.description:
After breakfast with picnic lunch you will spend full day exploring this unique park which forms the northern part of the famous Serengeti National Park. This will be a day of unlimited game drives for you to explore the depth and breadth of this famous park.

To bring more texture to your experience at the Mara, you may want to take advantage of several optional events we offer at an extra cost. Experience a visit to the local Maasai people in their nearby village. Meet these indigenous people and see up close their ancient lifestyle and culture. Want an unforgettable sight? Take a pre-dawn hot air balloon ride high above the reserve as the morning light breaks across the golden savannah and witness the herds of wildlife emerging into the day. Your driver/guide can arrange either of these optional excursions.

day_3.description:
After breakfast, check out of the camp and proceed for a final game drive en route Nairobi. In Nairobi, transfer to Wilson Airport for your flight to Diani. Diani beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Africa and the world at large with amazing all year weather.
You will be picked by our representative upon touching down at Ukunda Airstrip for a transfer to your beach resort where you will spend your beach holiday. You will spend the afternoon at leisure in the resort taking in the beautiful sights of the ocean and palm trees.
Dinner and overnight stay will be at the resort.

day_4.destination: Diani Beach
day_4.description:
This day will be spent here on the white sands of Diani beach at leisure with an option of engaging in water sports. Diani beach is an amazing sight with flawless long stretch of white sand hugged by lush forest. The beach is all magnificence, and we are not only talking about its marvelous coastline and deep blue waters here. We are talking of its overall ambiance, scenery and landscape.
Diani is an entertainer, and judging from the myriad of activities to engage in here, the chances of getting bored are at a zero. Deep-sea diving, snorkeling, diving, windsurfing, kayaking and kiting are some of the things you could do here. Depending on your adventure desire levels, you will partake in any of these activities.

day_5.destination: Diani Beach-Wasini Island
day_5.description: You will be picked up from the hotel in the early morning and proceed to Wasini Island - enjoy boat ride and snorkeling in the ocean with professional instructors. Wasini Island is renowned for dolphins and it’s possible to view them. Enjoy the great moments then later proceed to Swahili town of wasini and enjoy hot Swahili lunch of sea food before driving back to the hotel.

day_6.description: After breakfast and depending on your flight home - check out of the hotel and transfer to the airport to catch the flight to Nairobi. Arrive at JKIA and await for your flight time.

name: 12-Day Best of Safari Tanzania & Kenya Complete

overview.route_description: This trip allows you to visit the highlights of Tanzania and Kenya parks, going hand in hand with our team on the ground. They will lead you into the most beautiful destinations of Kenya and Tanzania. They have in-depth knowledge for the wildlife; flora and fauna that you will encounter along the safari trails. You will live unique sunrises, travelling through kilometers of landscapes that will leave you speechless, and you will sleep to the lullaby of the stars of the African night.

day_1.description: Upon arrival at Kilimanjaro Airport, our driver/guide will be waiting for you at the exit with a name sign ready to bring you Tulia Boutique Hotel in Arusha. You will rest here for the night, enjoying the peace and quiet, contemplating on the adventurous journey you're about to begin!

day_2.description: Today our guide will pick you up in the morning from your hotel in Arusha. The drive to Tarangire National Park will take about 2 hours. Once we arrive at the park we will start the game drive. Tarangire is famous for its large elephant population. You can also find many zebras, wildebeest, giraffes and even lions and cheetahs. We will have lunch at the picnic site in the park and in the afternoon we continue our game drive. At the end of the day we slowly drive out of the park and head to Marera Valley Lodge. Marera Valley Lodge, located on the outskirts of Karatu town about midway between Lake Manyara and the Ngorongoro Crater. It has a beautiful view over the valley to the hills beyond.

day_3.description:
After a good night sleep it’s time to go to Lake Manyara. Lake Manyara is known for the tree climbing lions, the soda ash
lake and its flamingos. Between the game drives we will find a nice picnic site to enjoy our lunch. In addition you can book a
walking safari and enjoy the park by foot with a park ranger. An amazing experience to see the animals up close! After our
afternoon game drive it’s time to head to Marera valley Lodge.

day_4.destination: Ngorongoro Crater
day_4.description:
Today we drive early into the amazing Ngorongoro crater. The Ngorongoro Crater is the world’s largest inactive, intact and
unfilled volcanic caldera. Approximately 25,000 large animals live in the crater. We will find many zebras, wildebeest, elephants and if we’re lucky even rhinos! In the evening we overnight at Ngorongoro Wild Camp which is beautifully located in the nature of the Ngorongoro Conservation Area.

day_5.destination: Serengeti National Park
day_5.description:
Today we’re heading to the famous Serengeti. We will arrive at the gate around lunch time. The rest of the day we will be doing a game drive on the endless plains of this amazing park. The Serengeti is famous for its annual migration of over 1.5 million white-bearded wildebeest and 250,000 zebra and for its numerous Nile crocodile and honey badger. Our guides love to take you off the beaten track and find the best places to spot the animals. In the evening you overnight at Serengeti Wildebeest Camp. This comfortable tented lodge is scenically located where sun-rise is your daily wake-up call and beautiful sun-set will always alert you to go to the camp fire or a sundowner.

The next day we have a full day to explore the Serengeti plains. We stay one more night at Serengeti Wildebeest Camp.

day_6.description: On day 7 we have a full day to explore the Serengeti plains and wildlife capturing the best view of wild animals in their natural habitat. In the evening we will stay another night at Ikoma Wild Camp which is located in the buffer zone of Serengeti Ecosystem between Grumeti and the Ikorongo Game reserve, which is full of wildlife throughout the year.

name: 9-Day Best of Safari Tanzania & Kenya Complete

overview.route_description: This trip allows you to visit the highlights of Tanzania and Kenya parks, going hand in hand with our team on the ground. They will lead you into the most beautiful destinations of Kenya and Tanzania. They have in-depth knowledge for the wildlife; flora and fauna that you will encounter along the safari trails. You will live unique sunrises, travelling through kilometers of landscapes that will leave you speechless, and you will sleep to the lullaby of the stars of the African night.

name: 2-Day Tsavo East National & Taita Hills

overview.route_description: A stop over at the Tsavo East National Park for a brief game drive before heading to Taita Hills, will give you the true sample of adventure. The later accommodation is on stilts and has an underground tunnel with 360 degrees wildlife viewing. This area was the battle field in the second world war.

day_2.description: After breakfast embark on a mid-morning game drive through this reserve. After lunch, depart for Mombasa and you'll be dropped off at your beach hotel or onward arrangements.

name: 13-Day Gorillas & the Big Five

overview.route_description: This truly memorable holiday is for those wanting the bucket-list experiences of an authentic Kenyan safari and the chance to track the rare mountain gorilla in the equatorial forests of Rwanda. From the plains of Masai Mara to the towering mountains of Volcanoes National Park, your whirlwind tour features East Africa's two most popular destinations. Of course, there are five rounds of superb golf in the capital cities of Nairobi and Kigali, too—each with unique and distinct flavours!

day_1.description:
Arrive at Nairobi International Airport, where our representative will meet you. Enjoy a warm welcome and assistance with transfer to your luxurious hotel in the Karen residential area of the city. Check into the Hemingways Nairobi hotel for four nights.
Freshen up and spend the rest of the day on your own.

day_2.destination: Golf at Muthaiga Golf Club / Giraffe Centre
day_2.description:
Enjoy breakfast in Nairobi. Situated along the Nairobi River in beautiful Kenya, the capital of Nairobi is East Africa's most cosmopolitan city. Although it has developed a reputation that keeps tourist visits brief, there are fascinating attractions. After breakfast, transfer for your first round of golf. Play 18 holes at Muthiaga Golf Club (includes green fee and caddy). The Peter Matkovich-designed Muthaiga Golf Club is an 18-hole layout bordered by the Karura Forest, roughly 15km from the centre of Nairobi. It has been voted one of Southern Africa’s top golf courses by SA Golf Digest and has been the home of the Kenya Open Golf Championship (part of European PGA) until 2004. This is a walking-only course, but caddies are available. Spend the afternoon on a half-day guided tour of Nairobi, including stops at the Karen Blixen Museum.
The book and movie “Out of Africa” and the Giraffe Centre are famous for being home to a towering crew of endangered Rothschild’s giraffes.

day_3.description: After breakfast, you will visit the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust on a half-day tour of a Nairobi elephant orphanage, home to adorable baby elephants that conservationists have rescued. You will love to watch the baby animals frolic in a mud bath, get up close to them and benefit from the chance to touch them as their handlers feed them milk. Then, return to your hotel, and after a short rest, transfer for your next round of golf. Play 18 holes at Karen Country Club Golf Course (includes green fee and caddy). Karen Country Club has some unique features that distinguish it from other golfing clubs in Kenya:- flowering shrubs, lakes and wetlands, outstanding indigenous trees, and many fine sporting amenities. Founded in 1937, Karen Country Club prides itself on being one of the oldest golf clubs in Kenya. With the Ngong Hills as a backdrop, the course is much admired.

day_4.destination: Golf at Winsdor Golf Course
day_4.description: After breakfast, meet your driver for transfer to your next round of golf. Play 18 holes at Winsdor Golf Club (includes green fee and caddy). The Tom Macauley-designed Winsdor Golf Club threads its way through coffee farms and indigenous forests with high and low terrain, giving it character and design quality. The layout boasts lush, springy fairways, fast, true greens, and a sprinkling of attractive water hazards with 73 well-located sand bunkers and unforgiving roughs, which make this course truly special. Finally, spend the evening at leisure on your own, perhaps exploring the myriad sights and sounds locally.

day_5.destination: Transfer to Mara North Conservancy
day_5.description: After your breakfast in Nairobi, meet your driver, who will transfer you to Wilson Airport. Next, fly to the Keekorok Airstrip in Masai Mara. On arrival, you'll be transferred to the camp. Check into the Elewana Elephant Pepper Camp for three nights. Situated in southwest Kenya, the Mara North Conservancy is a beautiful private wilderness spanning more than 30,000 hectares. It is home to an array of plants, reptiles, birds, and mammals, including elephant, rhino, buffalo, lion, leopard, cheetah and wildebeest, zebra, gazelle, and other migratory wildlife. Leopard Gorge, in the heart of the conservancy, is famous as the setting of countless National Geographic documentaries. Along with the neighbouring Masai Mara National Reserve, this conservancy is vital for sustaining the famous Serengeti wildebeest migrations and the highly threatened African wild dog and black rhino species. Enjoy an afternoon game drive with sundowners, followed by a sumptuous dinner at the lodge.

day_6.description:
Wake up early with coffee and rusks for a morning game drive or a bush walk with expert rangers. You will visit the Mara North Conservancy and the adjoining Masai Mara National Reserve. You can do morning, evening or all-day game drives. Please note that viewing the main migration river crossings requires a full day out as they are located away from camp. Inquire about a Hot Air Balloon Safari over the Masai Mara for a once-in-a-lifetime safari experience (at your own cost)! Take the time to leave the car behind and enjoy the small things—animal tracks, flowers, and micro-ecosystems.
All the guides are bronze or silver level Kenya Professional Safari Guides Association certified, and they enjoy sharing their knowledge and can take you on a delightful ramble from camp.

day_1.description: In the morning, we pick up our clients from their hotel or the airport, and we depart at 7.30 am. We continue with the safari to Masai Mara National Reserve. This enormous reserve is actually part of the vast Serengeti plains, famously known for its spectacular great wildebeest migration. It is home to the Big Five - lion, elephant, leopard, buffalo, and rhino. Enjoy lunch at the camp/lodge and relax before departing for the afternoon game drive. The Mara National Reserve is one of the greatest wildernesses in the world. Large mammals are varied and easy to see. The wild animals in the park are Maasai giraffe, buffalo, eland, and thousands of plains game including impala, zebra, and Grant's gazelle.

day_1.description: Pick up from your Nairobi Hotel early morning at 6:00am. Drive to lake Nakuru arriving in time for lunch, check in at Sarova Lion Hill Lodge. Afternoon game drive across the Pink Lake often referred so due to it’s Great masses of Flamingos not forgetting the famous white Rhino and black rhino found in this park. Dinner and overnight at Sarova lion hill. Full Board accommodation too. Lake Nakuru houses Kenya’s first rhino sanctuary and one of the largest concentrations of black rhinoceros in the world a large population of white rhino. The park features the picturesque Malaika Waterfalls. Also of interest is an area of 188 km around the lake fenced off as a sanctuary to protect Rothschild giraffes. Among predators are lion, leopard and large pythons. Others include Thomson’s and Grant gazelle, the long- eared leaf-nosed bat, colobus monkey, rock hyrax, hippo, and waterbuck; Impala, striped hyena, bat-eared fox, wildcat, reedbuck and golden cat.

day_2.description: Early morning breakfast, after breakfast leave Lake Nakuru for Masai mara arrivinge in time for lunch. Check in at the Olengoti Eco Camp and have lunch. Afternoon game drive through the park in search of the Lion, Cheetah, Elephant and Buffalo and leopards among numerous other animals. Dinner and overnight at Olengoti Eco Camp. These accommodation can be changed in regard to your choices} The Mara is magnificent, home to Kenya’s richest concentration of wildlife, and regarded by many travelers as an essential stop on any tour of Africa. When westerners think of Africa and safari, this is place they imagine – golden grassland plains pocked with acacia, wildebeests, zebras, lions, and jackals bound by together by the cycle of life and death. Three days here will only scratch at the surface of the wonders of the Mara.

day_3.description: After an early morning breakfast, depart for a half day tour of the maasai mara with hopes of seeing the wildebeest migration crossing the mara river( July to October only). You may have picnic lunch by the river or return to the camp depending on how the day plays out. Proceed with afternoon/evening game drive returning to the lodge at 6.00 p.m. Dinner and overnight at the Olengoti Eco Safari Camp.

day_4.destination: Masai mara to Nairobi
day_4.description: Have your breakfast early then depart for your last game drive in the masai mara as you leave for your drive back to Nairobi at 10.30 a.m.. Lunch will be at the Seasons Hotel in Narok town. After lunch, proceed to Nairobi arriving at around 4.00 p.m. Transfer to your City hotel or Jomo Kenyatta International Airport. Meal Plan{Breakfast and Lunch}.

day_1.description: Arrive at Nairobi International Airport, where our representative will meet you. Welcome and assistance with transfer to your luxurious hotel in the Karen residential area of the city. Check in to the Hemingways Nairobi hotel for four nights. Freshen up and spend the rest of the day on your own.

day_2.destination: Golf at Muthaiga Golf Club / Giraffe Centre
day_2.description:
Situated along the Nairobi River in beautiful Kenya, the capital of Nairobi is East Africa's most cosmopolitan city. Although it has developed a reputation that keeps tourist visits brief, there are some fascinating attractions. After breakfast, transfer for your first round of golf. Play 18 holes at Muthiaga Golf Club (Includes Green Fee and Caddy). The Peter Matkovich-designed Muthaiga Golf Club is a private, 18-hole layout bordered by the Karura Forest, roughly 15 km from the center of Nairobi. It has been voted one of Southern Africa's top golf courses by SA Golf Digest and has been the home of the Kenya Open Golf Championship (part of European PGA) until 2004. This is a walking-only course; however, caddies are available.
Spend the afternoon on a half-day guided tour of Nairobi, including stops at the Karen Blixen Museum - now famous for the book and movie "Out of Africa" and the Giraffe Centre - the latter being home to a towering crew of endangered Rothschild's giraffes.

day_3.description: After breakfast, you will visit the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust on a half-day tour of a Nairobi elephant orphanage home to adorable baby elephants that conservationists have rescued. You will love to watch the baby animals frolic in a mud bath, get up close to them and benefit from the chance to touch them as their handlers feed them milk. Then, return to your hotel, and after a short rest, transfer for your next round of golf. Play 18 holes at Karen Country Club Golf Course (Includes Green Fee and Caddy). Karen Country Club has some unique features that distinguish it from other golfing clubs in Kenya:- flowering shrubs, lakes and wetlands, outstanding indigenous trees, and many fine sporting amenities. Founded in 1937, Karen Country Club, Nairobi prides itself on being one of the oldest golf clubs in Kenya. With the Ngong Hills as a backdrop, the course is much admired.

day_4.destination: Golf at Windsor Golf Course
day_4.description: After breakfast, meet your driver for transfer to your next round of golf. Play 18 holes at Windsor Golf Course (Includes Green Fee and Caddy). The Tom Macauley-designed Winsdor Golf Club threads its way through coffee farms and indigenous forests with high and low terrain, giving it character and design quality. The layout boasts lush, springy fairways, fast, genuine greens, and a sprinkling of attractive water hazards with 73 well-located sand bunkers and unforgiving roughs, which make this course truly special. Finally, spend the evening at leisure on your own, perhaps exploring the myriad sights and sounds locally.

Situated in southwest Kenya, the Mara North Conservancy is a beautiful private wilderness spanning more than 30,000 hectares. It is home to an array of plants, reptiles, birds, and mammals, including elephant, rhino, buffalo, lion, leopard, cheetah and wildebeest, zebra, gazelle, and other migratory wildlife. Leopard Gorge, in the heart of the conservancy, is famous as the setting of  BBC Big Cat Diaries and National Geographic documentaries. Along with the neighboring Masai Mara National Reserve, this conservancy is vital for sustaining the Serengeti wildebeest migrations and the highly threatened African wild dog and black rhino species. Enjoy an afternoon game drive with a sundowner, followed by a sumptuous dinner at the lodge.

day_6.description: Wake up early with coffee and rusks for a morning game drive or a bush walk with expert rangers. You will visit the Mara North Conservancy and the adjoining Masai Mara National Reserve and can do morning, evening, or all-day game drives. Viewing the main migration river crossings requires a full day out as they are located someway from camp. Inquire about a Hot Air Balloon Safari over the Masai Mara for a once-in-a-lifetime Safari Experience! (at your own cost). Take the time to leave the car behind and enjoy the small things – animal tracks, flowers, and micro-ecosystems. All the guides are Bronze or Silver level Kenya Professional Safari Guides Association certified and enjoy sharing their knowledge, and can take you on a delightful ramble from camp.

name: 13-Day Kenya Safari and Zanzibar Holiday

overview.route_description: This luxury holiday offers first-class safari experience in the Masai Mara in Kenya, where you’ll enjoy exciting game drives with highly experienced local guides. You’ll stay at an exclusive camp set in a breathtaking location, right in the heart of the action. Following your spectacular safari, you will be flown to Zanzibar's historic capital Stone Town, to soak up their fascinating culture and history. End your holidays with the utmost relaxation on Zanzibar's pristine coast.

day_1.destination: Arrive in Nairobi & Fly to Masai Mara National Reserve
day_1.description:
On this holiday, we offer a ‘meet and assist’ service. As soon as you disembark the aircraft from your international flight, you will receive a warm welcome from a friendly representative who will escort you through immigration, customs and baggage collection. They will remain with you until you meet your driver in the arrivals area. You will then be transferred to the domestic airport where you’ll board a light aircraft flight to the Masai Mara National Reserve.

Upon arrival at the Masai Mara, you will be met by a representative and driven to Saruni Wild where you will stay for the next four nights.

We work with a number of luxury lodges and safari camps within the Masai Mara and in the outlying conservancies (including Sir Richard Branson’s 12-tented luxury safari camp within the Olare Motorogi Conservancy). We will ensure that we match you to the most suitable accommodation for your requirements, sense of style and budget.

day_2.description:
Over the next three days, you’ll enjoy incredible morning and afternoon game drives on the plains of Masai Mara. This iconic reserve offers amazing wildlife viewing opportunities and it’s highly likely that you’ll see zebra, impala, gazelle, wildebeest, buffalo, rhino, elephant, lions, cheetahs and leopards.

Saruni Wild also offer the opportunity for a night game drive where you’ll see nocturnal animals such as aardvarks and honey badgers. For those interested in a slower pace and experiencing some of the smaller details of the bush, nature walks are also possible.

As well as game drives, there are a range of other activities you can participate in during your time in the Masai Mara, including cultural visits to Maasai villages and markets. Alternatively, you may wish to take an early morning hot air balloon flight over the plains and forests of the Masai Mara, followed by a champagne breakfast, which can be added at an extra cost.

day_3.destination: Fly to Zanzibar & Transfer to Stone Town
day_3.description:
Today you’ll enjoy an early morning game drive before being driven to the airstrip in time for your scheduled light aircraft flight to Nairobi, where you’ll board a connecting flight to the exotic island of Zanzibar.

You will be met on arrival in Zanzibar and driven to your luxury accommodation in the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Stone Town, where you’ll spend the next two nights. Your exquisite hotel is located in the ‘Old Town’ surrounded by sultan's palaces, Portuguese forts, ancient dhow harbours, and colourful bazaars.

day_4.destination: Explore Stone Town
day_4.description:
Today you’ll have a full day to explore Stone Town’s labyrinth of winding alleyways and discover the ancient stone houses, carved wooden doors, Arabian arches, latticed windows, and overhanging balconies.

You may also want to explore cultural places of interest, including the Portuguese Fort, the old Dhow Port, the Old Slave Market, the Sultan's Palace, the House of Wonders, Livingstone House, the Hamamni Baths and the Persian Baths of Kidichi.

day_5.destination: Transfer to Zanzibar Beaches
day_5.description:
After breakfast, you’ll check out of your Stone Town hotel and then be driven to your luxurious beach accommodation where you’ll spend the next six nights.

Pongwe is one of the most popular options on the island and it is situated on Zanzibar’s east coast which has some of its best beaches. It was refurbished in 2017 and it is a relatively simple, quiet and laid-back lodge, perfect for some time relaxing and soaking up some sunshine. Stay in a beachfront room on a bed and breakfast basis.

We'll work with a variety of accommodation options on Zanzibar and the surrounding islands and we can suggest the perfect option for your interests and requirements.

day_6.description:
Enjoy Zanzibar at leisure. There are plenty of excursions that you can join during your time here, including visits to Jozani Forest, Prison Island, the spice plantations and cultural tours to local villages.

There’s also a wide choice of adventure activities that you can participate in, including mountain biking, hiking, bird watching, wind surfing, kite surfing, sea kayaking and sailing. The island has fantastic coral reefs which are perfect for diving and snorkelling—you may even be lucky enough to see dolphins and green turtles.

name: 3-Day Masai Mara Midrange Game Package

overview.route_description: The Masai Mara plains are full of wildebeest during migration season (early July to the end of September). Zebra, impala, topi, giraffe, and Thomson’s gazelle are regularly seen as leopards, lions, hyenas, cheetahs, jackals, and bat-eared foxes angle for a kill. Black rhinos are timid and hard to spot but are occasionally spotted. Hippos are abundant in the Mara River, as are giant Nile crocodiles, who lay in wait for a meal as the wildebeest cross on their annual quest to find new pastures.

day_1.description:
Early morning pick up from your Nairobi hotel or Airport and drive to Masai Mara. A 5-hour drive to the main gate. You will pass through Narok town, a famous farming Masai town. You will arrive at Masai Mara around lunchtime. Check-in at Siana Springs Tented Camp. Later in the afternoon (around 3.00 Pm), proceed for an afternoon game drive through the park in search of the Lion, Cheetah, Elephant, Buffalo, and other members of the Big five plus other animals.

In the evening, return to camp for dinner and overnight stay.

day_2.destination: All-Day Pass in The Masai Mara
day_2.description:
Early breakfast and an all-day game drive inside the vast Masai Mara National Park. You'll see lots of wildlife and scenic views, such as the Mara River and its Nile crocodiles, the hippo pool playing host to gigantic hippos, and more. Around lunchtime, your driver guide will seek the perfect spot for a picnic lunch- which should be fun! You'll resume your game drive till evening, returning to camp for refreshment and relaxing, followed by dinner and an overnight stay at Siana Springs Tented Camp.

Optional activity if in a group: Sundowner on the Hills with canapes for 40 USD per person (requires a Minimum of 4 Pax to run). While at the camp, you may also inquire about this service and pay directly if there is a quorum.

day_3.destination: Depart the Mara back to Nairobi
day_3.description:
After breakfast, it's time to bid farewell to the majestic Mara. On the way, you'll have a chance to spot the animals one last time. On the 4-5 hours drive back to Nairobi, you'll make stops for the bathroom, lunch (0out-of-pocket), and stretch about. ETA in Nairobi is around 2.00pm, leaving ample time for the airport check-in procedures (if outbound) or just checking into your Nairobi stay for an afternoon siesta.

At the end of your safari, we'll invite you to review our services, as this feedback is critical to improving customer experiences.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 5-Day Lake Naivasha, Lake Nakuru & Maasai Mara Mid-Range

overview.route_description: This tour allows you to traverse on the floor of the Great Rift Valley as you head to Lake Naivasha and Lake Nakuru National Park which are home animal species that include buffalos, giraffes, waterbucks, lions, impalas as well as many bird species. Later you proceed to the famous Maasai Mara National Reserve which is one one of Africa’s Greatest Wildlife Reserves and famous for its annual wildebeest migration. You can see all the BIG FIVE here.

day_1.destination: Nairobi to Lake Naivasha Appx: 100km - 2hrs drive
day_1.description:
On this first day, you will depart for Naivasha with brief stops at the view-points to marvel at the scenic-great rift valley escarpment. Arrival in good time for lunch.
The Great Rift Valley stretches from the Beqaa Valley in Lebanon which is in Asia to Mozambique in Southeast Africa. It’s a series of contiguous geographic trenches, approximately 6,800 kilometers (4,300 miles) in total length, and much of it is found in Kenya, where it has literally cut the country in two.

The shores host abundant birdlife including pelicans, cormorants, and fish-eagles with their haunting cry. There are more animals per acre than any other Kenyan Park, hence many film companies have been to the Island to film the herds of Wildebeest, Giraffe, Waterbuck, Zebra, Buffalo and Gazelle.

Optional visit by boat to the hidden gem, Crescent Island Game Sanctuary which is surrounded by water (it is actually a peninsula). Cost $ 60 per person.

Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_2.destination: Lake Naivasha to Lake Nakuru Appx: 80kms - 2hrs drive
day_2.description:
After breakfast, we depart for Lake Nakuru National Park which is one of the Rift Valley soda lakes at an elevation of 1,754 m (5,755 ft.) above sea level. The Park size is about 188 square kilometers and ideal for bird watching and wildlife viewing. It’s also a sanctuary to the black and white rhinos. Lake Nakuru national park also hosts the rare Rothschild’s giraffe which was introduced to the park in 1977, luckily these animals have become accustomed to the vegetation type in Lake Nakuru national park and have slowly become an indigenous species of the park. The lake's abundance of blue-green algae used to attract a vast quantity of flamingos that famously lined the shore.
We shall arrive in good time for lunch. Later proceed for an afternoon game viewing drive.
At sunset we shall go back to the booked lodge for dinner and overnight.

day_3.destination: Lake Nakuru to Maasai Mara - Appx 220 kms 4 to 5 hrs drive
day_3.description:
After early breakfast, we shall then proceed to Maasai Mara Game reserve arriving for lunch.
The reserve is in South West Kenya, with vast scenic expanse of gently rolling African Savannah plains measuring approximately 1510 square kilometers in area and bordering Serengeti National Park in Tanzania to the south. Its famous for its spectacular natural diversity of wildlife and happens to be a premier Kenya safari location in East Africa, offering visitors many reasons to visit this animal paradise.
Large numbers of Lion, Cheetah, Leopard, Elephant, African Buffalo, Wildebeest, Giraffe, Rhino, Zebra, Gazelle, and many more animals are found in the park in their natural habitat unconfined and free to roam the vast wilderness stretching for miles on end.
Afternoon game viewing drive and later back to the lodge for dinner and overnight.

day_4.destination: Maasai Mara
day_4.description:
On this day, you may opt to have the full day game drives or game drives in separate successions so that you may also have a chance to enjoy lodge/camp facilities.
If you opt for the full day game drive, you will then have picnic lunch boxes for the day.

The driver guide shall be readily available to discuss your daily activities as per your preferences.

(Perfect day to undertake optional balloon ride over the plains of Maasai Mara at a fee - $ 480 per person).

Dinner and overnight at the booked lodge.

day_5.destination: Maasai Mara to Nairobi - Appx 280 kms 5 to 6 hrs drive
day_5.description:
Early breakfast then check-out and proceed for the morning game viewing drives at the Maasai Mara as you exit the park. Thereafter depart for Nairobi arriving in late afternoon.
Drop off at your hotel/residence/Airport for your onward flight.

day_6.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

Located in the Great Rift Valley in primarily open grassland. Wildlife is most concentrated on the reserve’s western escarpment. It is regarded as the jewel of Kenya’s wildlife Viewing areas.

day_1.description:
At 8 o'clock you will be picked up from your Nairobi Hotel and commence the drive to Maasai Mara. You will pass via the great rift valley view point where you will have a stop over of 10 -15 minutes to view the rift valley. Lunch will be at the lodge in Maasai Mara. In the afternoon after you check in, depart for a sunset evening game viewing drive in the Mara Reserve (4.00 to 6.00 pm). Return back to the camp for buffet dinner ending with good time for resting at the lodge.
Masai Mara Reserve is the most popular tourism destination in Kenya. Located in the Great Rift Valley in primarily open grassland. Wildlife is most concentrated on the reserve’s western escarpment. Its regarded as the jewel of Kenya’s wildlife Viewing areas.

day_2.description: At around 7:00 am after breakfast, you will leave for a full day exploring Masai Mara in search of the Big Five and the annual wildebeest’s migration which alone involves over 1.5 million animals arriving in July and departing in November. The phenomenal wildebeest migration which is a spectacular event only seen in Maasai mara is the seventh wonder of the world. At midday, You will have picnic lunch in the park which is provided by us. You will visit the site of the yearly wildebeest migration and see the resident crocodiles and hippos sited at the banks of Mara river, Then continue with the game drive and explore the beauty of the mara reserve until evening. Return to lodge for dinner and overnight.

day_3.description: Early morning breakfast then check out for your drive back to Nairobi while enjoying a short en-route game drive on your way. A simple complimentary lunch will be provided on the way in a travelers motel. On arrival you will be dropped at your Nairobi Hotel. This marks the end of the tour.

day_4.destination: End of tour (See Getting There for more details)

name: 8-Day Amboseli, Lake Naivasha, Lake Nakuru & Masai Mara

overview.route_description: On this 8 Day Safari you will be visiting Amboseli, stay at the Oltukai Lodge, this lodge offers spectacular views of Mt. Kilimanjaro. Proceed to Lake Naivasha for an afternoon of activities around the Lake as well as a visit to the Crescent Island. Lake Nakuru is famed for its large flocks of flamingos and the black and white rhinoceros among other herbivores. Stay at the Sarova Lion Hill Lodge. End your safari in the Masai mara where you will spend three Nights staying at mid range camp/lodge.

day_1.description: Pick up from Nairobi (Pick location Nairobi CBD) 7.00 a.m in the morning and drive south across the Athi Plains, home of the Masai, via the trading town of Namanga near the Tanzanian border and on to Amboseli. Enter Amboseli Park driving slowly, looking for lions, elephants, cheetahs, leopards, gazelles, antelopes and different kind of birds. Check in at the Oltukai Lodge, after checking in take your lunch followed by a short afternoon relaxation. At 4 pm go for the evening game drive in the small but game filled Amboseli national park with a chance to see Elephants, lions, cheetahs, gazelles, wildebeests, buffalos zebras, warthogs, different birds and of course Mount Kilimanjaro. Dinner and overnight at the Oltukai Lodge. Meal Plan {Full Board}.

day_2.description: Have an early morning cup of coffee/tea then depart for an early morning game at 6.15 a.m. to 8.15 a.m followed by breakfast. At 9.00 a.m., depart for a mid-morning game drive exploring Amboseli until 11.30 a.m. when you drive back to the Lodge for lunch. After lunch, relax enjoying the lodge facilities until 4.00 pm when you leave for an evening game drive. At 6.00 p.m. return to the Oltukai Lodge. Meal Plan {Full Board}.

day_3.description: Depart Amboseli after breakfast and drive to Lake Naivasha, a distance of 300 Km, approximately 4.5 Hours Drive. On Arrival, check in at the Lake Naivasha Sopa Lodge for relaxation as well as have lunch. Depart for an afternoon tour of the Lake as well as a visit to the Crescent Island. Dinner and overnight at the Lake Naivasha Sopa Lodge. Meal Plan: Full Board.

day_4.destination: Lake Naivasha to Lake Nakuru
day_4.description: An optional visit to the Hell's Gate National park then proceed to Lake Nakuru National Park. Have a an extended game viewing session en route to the Sarova Lion Hill Lodge for lunch. Afternoon game drive at 4.00 to 6.00 p.m. Dinner and overnight at the Sarova Lion Hill Lodge.

day_5.destination: Lake Nakuru to Masai mara
day_5.description: Have an early game drive at 6.00 a.m to 7.30 a.m followed by breakfast. After breakfast drive to the Maasai mara arriving in good time for lunch. Lunch will be at the Ashnil Mara Camp. After lunch, you will relax until 4.00 p.m time for your evening game drive. Dinner and overnight at the Ashnil Mara Camp. Meal Plan{Full board}.

day_6.description: Have an early morning cup of coffee then depart for a game viewing session at 6.30 am to 9.30 am. Return to the Mara Ashnil Mara Camp for breakfast. Stay at the camp relaxing and enjoying the facilities as well as have your lunch. Evening Game drive at 3.45 p.m to 6.00 pm. Dinner and overnight at the Ashnil Mara Camp. Meal Plan {Full Board}.
